verses.latin: Factum est autem postquam percussit Alexander, filius Philippi Macedo, qui primus regnavit in Graecia, egressus de terra Cethim,
verses.english: After Alexander of Macedon, son of Philip, the first to reign over Greece, defeated many kings and then left the land of Kittim,

verses.latin: et percussit Darius regem Persarum et Medorum, ipse gessit multa proeliorum bella,
verses.english: he fought many wars against King Darius of Persia and Media,

verses.latin: et constituit bella multa, et obtinuit munitiones et occidit reges terrae.
verses.english: and he conquered fortresses and killed the kings of the land.

verses.latin: Et processit usque ad fines terrae, et accepit spolia multitudinis gentium, et siluit terra in conspectu ejus.
verses.english: He went to the ends of the earth, seizing plunder from many nations, and the earth was quiet before him.

verses.latin: Et exaltatus est cor Alexandri, et elevatus est.
verses.english: Alexander became arrogant, and his heart was lifted up.

verses.latin: Et congregavit virtutem nimiam, et dominatus est regionis, et gentium, et regum.
verses.english: He gathered a very strong army and ruled over the region, the nations, and the kings.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est, et cognovit quod moriturus esset.
verses.english: He died, and he realized that he was about to die.

verses.latin: Et vocavit pueros suos, qui erant nobiles et nutriti cum eo a juventute, et divisit eis regnum suum, cum adhuc viveret.
verses.english: He called his servants, who were noble and had been raised with him since his youth, and he divided his kingdom among them while he was still alive.

verses.latin: Et regnavit Alexander annis duodecim, et mortuus est.
verses.english: Alexander reigned for twelve years, and then he died.

verses.latin: Et diviserunt pueri ejus regnum ejus, et adsumpserunt sibi potestatem, et omnes induerunt sibi diademata post mortem ejus, et filii eorum post eos annis multis: et multiplicata sunt mala in terra.
verses.english: His servants divided his kingdom, taking power, and they all put on crowns after his death, and so did their sons after them for many years: and evil increased in the land.

verses.latin: Et exivit ex eis radix peccator, Antiochus cognomento Epiphanes, filius Antiochi regis, qui fuerat obses Romae, et regnavit in anno centesimo trigesimo septimo regni Graecorum.
verses.english: Then came forth a sinful root, Antiochus, called Epiphanes, son of King Antiochus, who had been a hostage in Rome, and he reigned in the one hundred and thirty-seventh year of the kingdom of the Greeks.

verses.latin: In diebus illis exierunt de Israël filii iniquitatis, et suaserunt multos dicentes: Eamus, et paciscamur foedus cum gentibus, quae in circuitu nostro sunt: quia postquam recessimus ab eis, contigerunt nobis multa mala.
verses.english: In those days, some wicked men of Israel went out and persuaded many, saying, “Let us go and make a covenant with the Gentiles around us. For since we separated ourselves from them, many evils have befallen us.”

verses.latin: Et placuit sermo in oculis eorum.
verses.english: This speech pleased them.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad regem Antiochum, et dederunt ei potestatem, et fecit eis licentiam facere secundum judicia gentium.
verses.english: They sent word to King Antiochus, and he gave them authority to follow the customs of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt gymnasium in Jerusalem secundum leges nationum,
verses.english: They built a gymnasium in Jerusalem according to the laws of the nations,

verses.latin: et fecérunt sibi praeputia, et recesserunt a testamento sancto, et junxerunt se gentibus, et venundati sunt ut facerent malum.
verses.english: and they made themselves uncircumcised, and they abandoned the holy covenant, and joined themselves to the Gentiles, and were sold to do evil.

verses.latin: Et parata est regni ejus, et congregavit virtutem fortissimam, et intravit in terram Aegypti, ut regnaret super eam.
verses.english: The kingdom of Antiochus was prepared, and he gathered a very strong army, and entered into the land of Egypt, to reign over it.

verses.latin: Et venit in Aegyptum cum multitudine, cum curribus, et elephantis, et equitibus, et navibus multis,
verses.english: He came into Egypt with a multitude, with chariots, elephants, horsemen, and many ships,

verses.latin: et constituit praelium contra Ptolemaeum regem Aegypti: et timuit Ptolemaeus a facie ejus, et fugit.
verses.english: and he made war against Ptolemy, the king of Egypt: and Ptolemy was afraid before him, and fled.

verses.latin: Et cepit civitates munitas in terra Aegypti, et accepit spolia terrae Aegypti.
verses.english: He seized the fortified cities in the land of Egypt and plundered the land of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et percussit Antiochus Aegyptum, in anno centesimo quadragesimo tertio, et abiit, et ascendit in Israël.
verses.english: Antiochus struck Egypt in the one hundred and forty-third year, and then he went up to Israel.

verses.latin: Et ascendit in Jerusalem cum forti manu.
verses.english: He went up to Jerusalem with a strong army.

verses.latin: Et intravit in sanctuario cum superbia, et tulit altare aureum, et candelabrum luminis, et universa vasa ejus.
verses.english: He entered the sanctuary with arrogance, and took the golden altar, and the lampstand of light, and all its vessels.

verses.latin: Et mensam propositionis, et libamentorum vasa, et phialas, et thuribula aurea, et velum, et coronas, et ornatum aureum, quod erat in facie templi: et omnia diripuit.
verses.english: He took the table of the bread of the Presence, the vessels for libations, the bowls, the golden censers, the veil, the crowns, and the golden ornament that was on the facade of the temple: and he plundered it all.

verses.latin: Et tulit argentum, et aurum, et vasa desideriorum, et invenit thesaurum absconditum.
verses.english: He took silver, gold, and the precious vessels; and he found the hidden treasure.

verses.latin: Et tollens omnia, abiit in terram suam, et fecit caedem, et locutus est iniquitatem magnam.
verses.english: Taking it all, he went back to his own land, where he committed slaughter, and spoke great wickedness.

verses.latin: Et factus est luctus magnus in Israël, et in omni loco eorum.
verses.english: There was great mourning in Israel and in all their places.

verses.latin: Et gemuerunt principes et senes, pueri et puellae contabuerunt, et species mulierum inmutata est.
verses.english: The leaders and the elders groaned, the young men and maidens languished, and the beauty of the women was changed.

verses.latin: Et omnis sponsus assumpsit lamentationem, et quasi in moerorem ducta est sponsa.
verses.english: Every bridegroom took up lamentation, and the bride was, as it were, in mourning.

verses.latin: Et mota est terra super habitatores ejus, et omnis domus Jacob induit confusionem.
verses.english: The earth shook over its inhabitants, and the whole house of Jacob was covered with confusion.

verses.latin: Et post duos annos misit rex in civitates Juda, principem tributorum, et venit in Jerusalem cum magna multitudine.
verses.english: After two years, the king sent the chief tax collector into the cities of Judah, and he came to Jerusalem with a great multitude.

verses.latin: Et locutus est eis verba pacis fallacia, et crediderunt ei: et irruit repente in civitatem, et percussit eam plaga magna, et perdidit populum multum ex Israël.
verses.english: He spoke to them with deceitful words of peace, and they believed him: and he suddenly attacked the city, and struck it with a great plague, and destroyed many people of Israel.

verses.latin: Et rapuit spolia civitatis, et succendit eam igni, et demolitus est domos ejus, et muros ejus in circuitu.
verses.english: He plundered the city, and burned it with fire, and demolished its houses, and its walls around it.

verses.latin: Et captivos duxit mulieres et parvulos, et pecora possederunt.
verses.english: He took captive the women and children, and possessed the livestock.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt civitatem David muro magno et firmo, et turribus firmis, et facta est illis arx:
verses.english: They built the city of David with a great and strong wall, and strong towers, and it became a citadel for them:

verses.latin: et posuerunt illic gentem peccatorem, viros iniquos, et confirmaverunt se in ea.
verses.english: and they placed there a sinful people, wicked men, and they strengthened themselves in it.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt thesaurum in ea, et fecerunt arcanum, et facti sunt laqueus populo Israel semper, et insidiatores sanctuarii.
verses.english: They put treasure in it, and made a secret place, and they became a trap for the people of Israel always, and those who lay in wait for the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et effuderunt sanguinem innocentem in circuitu sanctuarii, et polluerunt sanctum.
verses.english: They shed innocent blood around the sanctuary and defiled the holy place.

verses.latin: Et timuit habitatio propter illos, et facta est habitatio gentium, et extitit populo alieno, et expulsus est, et recessit filiis suis.
verses.english: The inhabitants feared them, and the dwelling became the dwelling of the Gentiles, and it became foreign to the people, and they were driven out, and withdrew from their sons.

verses.latin: Et abstulit templum honorem ejus, et abstulerunt vasa ejus, et incenderunt sanctum ejus.
verses.english: They took away the glory of the temple, and took away its vessels, and they burned its holy place.

verses.latin: Et tradiderunt civitates Juda in perditionem.
verses.english: They gave the cities of Judah to destruction.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in Jerusalem, et habitaverunt illic alieni, et expulerunt filios Israel.
verses.english: And they came to Jerusalem, and strangers lived there, and they drove out the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et polluerunt sancta, et dederunt idola in templum.
verses.english: They defiled the holy things, and put idols in the temple.

verses.latin: Et miserunt in circuitu in omnes partes Juda, et eduxerunt de eis qui non erant iniquorum, et collegerunt exercitum.
verses.english: And they sent word around to all parts of Judah, and brought out those who were not wicked, and gathered an army.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in civitatem, et abstulerunt ea, et polluerunt sanctum.
verses.english: And they came to the city, and took it, and defiled the holy place.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt malitiam in circuitu sanctuarii, et gentiles.
verses.english: And they did evil around the sanctuary, and the Gentiles did too.

verses.latin: Et omnes nationes consenserunt, et dederunt ei potestatem.
verses.english: And all the nations agreed, and gave him power.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt in Jerusalem, secundum consuetudinem gentium, secundum idola, et non periculum faciebant.
verses.english: And they did in Jerusalem according to the customs of the Gentiles, according to idols, and they did not cause danger.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt in templo idola, et incenderunt templum in igne.
verses.english: And they placed idols in the temple, and burned the temple with fire.

verses.latin: Et effuderunt sanguinem justorum, et orationes eorum fecerunt super eos sanguinem.
verses.english: They shed the blood of the just, and turned their prayers into blood.

verses.latin: Et omnis populus qui erat in circuitu, adjuverunt eos.
verses.english: And all the people who were around, helped them.

verses.latin: Et mandavit rex universae terrae suae, ut esset unus populus universorum, et ut relinquerent unusquisque legem suam.
verses.english: And the king commanded his whole land, that all should be one people, and that everyone should abandon their own law.

verses.latin: Et consenserunt omnes gentes secundum verbum regis.
verses.english: And all the Gentiles agreed according to the king's word.

verses.latin: Et multi ex Israël acquieverunt servituti ejus, et immolaverunt idolis, et sabbatum pollaverunt.
verses.english: And many of Israel submitted to his servitude, and sacrificed to idols, and profaned the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et misit rex litteras per manus nuntiorum in Jerusalem, et in civitates Juda, ut sequerentur leges gentium terrae,
verses.english: And the king sent letters by the hand of messengers to Jerusalem, and to the cities of Judah, that they should follow the laws of the Gentiles of the land,

verses.latin: et ut prohiberent holocausta, et sacrificia, et libamina in sanctificatione templi,
verses.english: and that they should forbid the burnt offerings, sacrifices, and libations in the sanctification of the temple,

verses.latin: et ut polluant sabbata, et solemnitates,
verses.english: and that they should profane the sabbaths and solemnities,

verses.latin: et contaminent sancta, et sancta.
verses.english: and contaminate the holy things and the holy days.

verses.latin: Et ut aedificent altaria, et fana, et simulacra idolorum, et immolent porcellos, et animalia immunda,
verses.english: And that they should build altars, shrines, and idols, and sacrifice pigs and unclean animals,

verses.latin: et ut relinquant filios suos incircumcisi, et contaminent animas suas in omnibus immundis et abominandis,
verses.english: and that they should leave their sons uncircumcised, and defile their souls in all things unclean and abominable,

verses.latin: ut ponant animas suas in omni cultu idolorum, et oblivionem sancti nominis.
verses.english: that they should put their souls in all worship of idols, and forget the holy name.

verses.latin: Et quicumque non fecerit secundum verbum regis, moriatur.
verses.english: And whoever does not act according to the king's word, shall die.

verses.latin: Omnia haec scripsit in universam terram suam, et constituit praepositos super omnem populum, et mandavit civitatibus Juda, ut immolarent.
verses.english: He wrote all these things in his whole land, and appointed officials over all the people, and commanded the cities of Judah to sacrifice.

verses.latin: Tunc multi de populo, qui dereliquerant legem Domini, accesserunt ad eos, et fecerunt mala in terra,
verses.english: Then many of the people, who had forsaken the law of the Lord, went over to them, and did evil in the land,

verses.latin: et impulerunt Israël in absconditum.
verses.english: and led Israel into hiding.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, et audierunt Mathathias filius Ioannis, filii Simeonis, sacerdos ex filiis Ioarib, ab Hierusalem, quod defecerunt gentes a Juda et ab Hierusalem.
verses.english: Some time later, Mattathias, son of John, son of Simon, a priest from the family of Joarib, left Jerusalem upon hearing that many from Judah and Jerusalem were turning away from God.

verses.latin: Et quod fecerant opera impia in terra Israël, et inreverentiam magnam egerant in Hierusalem secundum consuetudinem gentium.
verses.english: The Jews were committing wicked acts in the land of Israel, and had shown great disrespect in Jerusalem, following the customs of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt Mathathias et filii ejus: Vae nobis! quid facti sumus, et quid evenit nobis?
verses.english: Mattathias and his sons said: “Woe to us! Why have we been born? What has happened to us?

verses.latin: Conlata sunt vasa sancta, et dispersa sunt filii nostri, et immolati sunt filii Sion in manibus inimicorum.
verses.english: The sacred vessels were taken and scattered, our sons are lost, and the sons of Zion have been murdered by our enemies.

verses.latin: Et abstulit gloriam, et subversum est regnum et sanctificatio ex nobis; et venimus ut gentibus.
verses.english: Glory has been taken from us, and the kingdom and the sanctity of God are overthrown; we are now like the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Cur ergo moramur?
verses.english: Why then do we delay?

verses.latin: Et congregaverunt se omnis populus ad eos.
verses.english: So all of the people gathered around them.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt in loco, qui dicitur Maspha, contra Hierusalem, quoniam locus orationis erat ibi in Israël.
verses.english: They gathered in a place called Mizpah, near Jerusalem, because it was a place of prayer in Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Jonathan, filius Mathathiae, et filii ejus, ad fratres suos: Deserta est nunc inimicorum nostra, et deversa est ad gentes.
verses.english: Jonathan, son of Mattathias, and his sons said to their brothers: “Now our enemies are united, and the Gentiles have turned against us.

verses.latin: Venite et confortemus populum nostrum, et pugnemus pro populo nostro et sanctis nostris.
verses.english: Come, let us strengthen our people, and fight for our people and for our holy things.”

verses.latin: Et congregata est omnis exercitus: et parati sunt ad bellum.
verses.english: So the whole army was gathered, and they were ready for battle.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Mathathias: Audite, viri, qui estis zelantes legem, ut faciatis judicium et justitiam in diebus vestris.
verses.english: Then Mattathias said: “Listen, you who are zealous for the law, so that you may do justice and righteousness in your days.

verses.latin: Ite post me.
verses.english: Follow me.

verses.latin: Mortui sunt enim fratres nostri, et dispersi sunt in terra propter opera impiorum: et venimus ut gentibus.
verses.english: Our brothers are dead, scattered throughout the land, because of the wicked deeds of the evildoers: and we are like the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Ergo congregamini omnes, et pugnemus pro anima nostra.
verses.english: So gather yourselves, and let us fight for our lives.”

verses.latin: Tunc congregatus est omnis exercitus in die, et fecerunt coetum in die sabbati.
verses.english: Then the whole army gathered on that day, and they held a meeting on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad eos: Quid hoc est, quod omnes reliquistis, et sedetis?
verses.english: They said to them: “Why is it that you all left, and are sitting still?

verses.latin: Dixerunt autem viri ex gentibus: Dimittite et faciatis, secundum verbum regis, et vivetis.
verses.english: The men of the Gentiles said: “Let us go and do as the king has commanded, and you will live.”

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad eos: Non faciemus, neque obediemus verbo regis, nec transgrediemur a religione nostra, neque a ulla parte operum nostrorum.
verses.english: They replied to them: “We will not do it, nor will we obey the king’s command, nor will we depart from our religion, nor from any part of our works.”

verses.latin: Tunc cessavit a proeliis.
verses.english: Then they stopped fighting.

verses.latin: Et erant multi ex Israël, qui consenserunt operibus impiorum, et immolaverunt idola, et profanaverunt sabbatum.
verses.english: Many Israelites agreed with the wicked deeds, and they sacrificed to idols, and profaned the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et ait Mathathias et filii ejus: Si omnes interfecerimus, sicut fratres nostri fecerunt, et non faciemus pro animabus nostris, et pro justitiis nostris, et pro sanctis nostris,
verses.english: Then Mattathias and his sons said: “If we all do as our brothers did, and do not fight for our lives, for our righteousness, and for our holy things,

verses.latin: omnes interficient nos in sabbatis.
verses.english: everyone will kill us on the Sabbaths.”

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt ad eos: et pugnaverunt cum eis: et interfecerunt eos in die sabbati.
verses.english: So they gathered against them: and fought with them: and killed them on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Et persequentibus eos in sabbatis, venerunt ad eos cum magno impetu.
verses.english: While they were pursuing them on the Sabbaths, they came upon them with great force.

verses.latin: Et interfecerunt eos in die illa, et cum impiis, et non fecerunt numerum.
verses.english: They killed them on that day, and with the wicked, and did not count them.

verses.latin: Et vestivit Mathathias et amici ejus, et discurrerunt per universam civitatem, et destruxerunt altaria impiorum.
verses.english: Mattathias and his friends dressed, and they ran throughout the entire city, and destroyed the altars of the wicked.

verses.latin: Et circumciderunt pueros, qui inveniebantur incircumcisi in finibus Israël, juxta legem.
verses.english: They circumcised the boys who were found uncircumcised in the borders of Israel, according to the law.

verses.latin: Et persequuti sunt filios superborum, et prosperatus est opus in manu eorum.
verses.english: And they pursued the sons of the proud, and the work prospered in their hands.

verses.latin: Et acquisierunt legem de manu gentium, et de manu regum, et non dederunt cornu peccatoribus.
verses.english: They gained the law from the hand of the Gentiles, and from the hand of the kings, and they did not give a place to sinners.

verses.latin: Et appropinquavit dies moriendi Mathathiae: et dixit filiis suis: Nunc confortata est superbia, et castigatio, et tempus perditionis, et ira indignationis.
verses.english: The day of Mattathias’s death approached: and he said to his sons: “Now pride, punishment, the time of destruction, and the wrath of indignation are established.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, filii, zelate legem, et date animas vestras pro testamento patrum vestrorum.
verses.english: Now therefore, sons, be zealous for the law, and give your lives for the covenant of your fathers.

verses.latin: Et respondens, dixit: Ecce, Simon frater vester, scio quod vir consilii est: ipsum audite semper, et ipse vobis erit pater.
verses.english: And he responded, saying: “Behold, Simon your brother, I know that he is a man of counsel: always listen to him, and he will be a father to you.”

verses.latin: Et Judas Machabaeus fortis a juventute sua, sit vobis dux exercitus, et ipse geret bellum gentium.
verses.english: And Judas Maccabaeus, strong from his youth, will be the leader of the army for you, and he will wage war against the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et adducetis ad vos omnes qui custodiunt legem, et facite vindictam populi vestri.
verses.english: And bring to yourselves all those who keep the law, and take vengeance on your people.

verses.latin: Retribuite gentibus retributionem eorum, et adtendite ad mandata legis.
verses.english: Repay the Gentiles their retribution, and pay attention to the commandments of the law.”

verses.latin: Et mortuus est Mathathias: et sepelierunt eum filii sui in sepulchris patrum suorum in Modin, et planxerunt eum omnis Israël planctu magno.
verses.english: Then Mattathias died: and his sons buried him in the tombs of their fathers in Modein, and all Israel mourned for him with great mourning.

verses.latin: In diebus illis surrexit Antiochus, filius regis Antiochi, ex urbe Roma, et regnabat in anno centesimo et septimo et trigesimo.
verses.english: In those days, Antiochus, the son of King Antiochus, departed from Rome, and he reigned in the one hundred and thirty-seventh year.

verses.latin: In diebus illis exierunt de Israel filii iniquitatis, et suaserunt multos dicentes: Eamus, et disponamus foedus cum gentibus, quae in circuitu nostro sunt: quia postquam recessimus ab eis, multa mala invenerunt nos.
verses.english: In those days, the sons of iniquity went out from Israel and persuaded many people, saying, “Let us go and make a covenant with the Gentiles who are around us. Because since we departed from them, many evils have befallen us.”

verses.latin: Et placuit sermo in oculis eorum.
verses.english: And this word seemed good in their eyes.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt de populo, et miserunt ad regem, et fecit eis potestatem, ut facerent secundum judicia gentium.
verses.english: And they appointed some of the people and sent them to the king, and the king gave them authority to do according to the customs of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt gymnasium in Jerusalem secundum leges nationum:
verses.english: And they built a gymnasium in Jerusalem, following the laws of the nations:

verses.latin: et effecerunt sibi praeputia, et recesserunt a testamento sancto, et junxerunt se gentibus, et venundati sunt ut facerent malum.
verses.english: they circumcised themselves, abandoned the holy covenant, allied themselves with the Gentiles, and sold themselves to do evil.

verses.latin: Et cum praevaleret regnum, misit Antiochus ad Jerusalem, in civitatem, ut conprimeret eam.
verses.english: And as the kingdom grew stronger, Antiochus sent to Jerusalem, to the city, to crush it.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est in eam cum magna multitudine, et accepit civitatem, et caedem magnam fecit in ea.
verses.english: And he entered it with a great multitude, took the city, and inflicted a great slaughter in it.

verses.latin: Et praecepit angelis suis, ut facerent, et exierunt, et percusserunt viros in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And he commanded his angels to do it, and they went out and struck the men in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et effuderunt sanguinem justi, et sanctificaverunt templum.
verses.english: And they shed the blood of the just and defiled the temple.

verses.latin: Et ceperunt spolia civitatis, et succenderunt eam igni, et domos ejus et muros ejus destruxerunt in gyro.
verses.english: And they seized the spoils of the city, burned it with fire, and destroyed its houses and walls all around.

verses.latin: Et mulieres et parvulos captivos duxerunt, et pecora possederunt.
verses.english: And they took women and children captive and took possession of the livestock.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt murum circumcirca civitatem David, magnum et firmum, et turres fortes, et factum est illis in arcem.
verses.english: And they built a wall around the city of David, great and strong, and strong towers, and it became a fortress for them.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt ibi gentem peccatricem, et viros iniquos: et munierunt se in ea.
verses.english: And they placed a sinful people and wicked men there, and they fortified themselves in it.

verses.latin: Et inposuerunt templum iniquum, et omnem nationem, quae ibi erat, cum malis operibus.
verses.english: And they imposed an unjust temple, and every nation that was there, with evil works.

verses.latin: Et abstulerunt sacrificium juge, et sacrificium pro peccato.
verses.english: And they took away the continual sacrifice and the sacrifice for sin.

verses.latin: Et inposuerunt abominatio desolationis in templo.
verses.english: And they set up the abomination of desolation in the temple.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt aras in civitatibus Juda in circuitu.
verses.english: And they built altars in the cities of Judah all around.

verses.latin: Et sacrificabant in foribus domorum, et in plateis.
verses.english: And they sacrificed at the gates of houses and in the streets.

verses.latin: Et libros legis reperientes, combusserunt igni.
verses.english: And they burned the books of the law with fire, which they had found.

verses.latin: Et quemcumque invenerunt habentem testamentum, et observantem legem, mandatis regis interficiebant.
verses.english: And they killed anyone they found possessing the testament and observing the law, by the king's command.

verses.latin: Et in virtute sua faciebant in Jerusalem, et in mensibus, et in diebus.
verses.english: And they acted with their might in Jerusalem, and in the months, and in the days.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad Beriam, cum multa violentia, ad complendam Jerusalem.
verses.english: And they sent to Beria with great violence, to fill Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et die vicesima et quinta mensis, immolabant super altare idolorum, quod erat super altare templi.
verses.english: And on the twenty-fifth day of the month, they sacrificed on the altar of idols, which was above the altar of the temple.

verses.latin: Et mulieres, quae circumciderant filios suos, interficiebant, secundum praeceptum, et filios eorum suspenderunt in collo.
verses.english: And they killed the women who had circumcised their sons, according to the command, and they hanged their sons by the neck.

verses.latin: Et multi de Israel stabiliverunt in se, et statuerunt non manducare immunda.
verses.english: And many of Israel resolved within themselves and determined not to eat anything unclean.

verses.latin: Et elegerunt mortem, ut non contaminarentur, et non poluerunt testamentum sanctum: et mortui sunt.
verses.english: And they chose death rather than be defiled and not pollute the holy covenant; and they died.

verses.latin: Et facta est ira magna super Israel.
verses.english: And great wrath came upon Israel.

verses.latin: In illis autem diebus surrexit Matthathias, filius Joannis, filii Simeonis, sacerdos de filiis Joarib, ab Jerusalem, et resedit in civitate Modin.
verses.english: In those days, Mattathias, the son of John, son of Simeon, a priest of the sons of Joarib, from Jerusalem, arose and settled in the city of Modin.

verses.latin: Et habebat filios quinque: Joannem, et Simonem, qui vocabatur Thassi, et Judam, qui vocabatur Maccabaeus.
verses.english: And he had five sons: John, and Simon, who was called Thassi, and Judas, who was called Maccabaeus.

verses.latin: Et Eleazarum, et Jonathan.
verses.english: And Eleazar, and Jonathan.

verses.latin: Et vidit zelum, et iniquitates, quae fiebant in Juda, et Jerusalem.
verses.english: And he saw the zeal and iniquities that were happening in Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Vae mihi! Quid natus sum videre? et contristatus sum propter contritionem populi mei, et contristatus sum propter contritionem sancti, et factus sum in manus alienorum.
verses.english: And he said: “Woe is me! Why was I born to see this? I am grieved by the destruction of my people, and I am grieved by the destruction of the holy place, and I have been delivered into the hands of foreigners.”

verses.latin: Et congregata sunt omnia vasa ejus, et exierunt in desertum, relinquerent ibi filios suos et uxores suas.
verses.english: And he gathered all of his belongings, and they went out into the desert, where they left their sons and their wives.

verses.latin: Et exierunt cum filiis suis, et pugnaverunt in desertum.
verses.english: And they went out with their sons and fought in the desert.

verses.latin: Et missus est a rege Antiochus, copias, ut cogerent eos, qui relicti erant, ut descenderent, et transgredirentur.
verses.english: And Antiochus the king sent troops to force those who were left to come down and transgress.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad Matthathiam: Filius es principis, et magnus, et nobilis in hac civitate, et hic congregatio, et gentes, quae in circuitu sunt, praesto sunt tibi.
verses.english: And they said to Mattathias: “You are the son of a prince, and you are great and noble in this city, and here is a gathering, and the Gentiles who are around are at your service.

verses.latin: Venite ergo primus, et fac mandatum regis, sicut fecerunt omnes gentes, et viri Juda, et qui remanserunt in Jerusalem, et eris tu et filii tui in numero amicorum regis, et magnificabimini, tu et filii tui, argento et auro, et donis multis.
verses.english: Come, therefore, first, and do the king’s command, as all the Gentiles and the men of Judah have done, and those who remained in Jerusalem. And you and your sons will be in the number of the king's friends, and you and your sons will be honored with silver and gold and many gifts.”

verses.latin: Et respondit Matthathias, et dixit magna voce: Etiam si omnes gentes, quae sunt in regno regis, audierint eum, et discesserint a cultu patrum suorum, et elegerint voluntates eorum.
verses.english: And Mattathias answered and said with a loud voice: “Even if all the Gentiles who are in the king’s kingdom have listened to him and have departed from the worship of their fathers and have chosen his desires.

verses.latin: Ego et filii mei, et fratres mei ambulabimus in testamento patrum nostrorum.
verses.english: I and my sons and my brothers will walk in the covenant of our fathers.

verses.latin: Absit a nobis, ut derelinquamus legem et judicia.
verses.english: May it be far from us that we should forsake the law and its judgments.

verses.latin: Non oboediemus verbis regis, nec transgrediemur a cultu nostro neque ad dextram neque ad sinistram.
verses.english: We will not obey the words of the king, nor will we transgress our worship, neither to the right nor to the left.”

verses.latin: Et cum finisset loqui sermones istos, accessit quidam Judaeus in conspectu omnium, ad sacrificandum idolis in civitate Modin, secundum praeceptum regis.
verses.english: And when he had finished speaking these words, a certain Jew approached in the sight of all, to sacrifice to idols in the city of Modin, according to the king’s command.

verses.latin: Et vidit hoc Matthathias, et inflammatus est zelo, et contremuerunt renes ejus, et commotus est in indignationem secundum judicium, et irruit, et percussit eum super altare.
verses.english: And Mattathias saw this, and he was inflamed with zeal, and his loins trembled, and he was moved to indignation according to judgment, and he rushed forward and struck him on the altar.

verses.latin: Et virum quoque, qui mandatum regis faciebat, percussit in eadem hora: et destruxerunt altare.
verses.english: And also the man who was carrying out the king's command, he struck in the same hour, and they destroyed the altar.

verses.latin: Et zelati sunt legem, sicut fecit Phinees cum Zambri filio Salomi.
verses.english: And they were zealous for the law, as Phinehas did with Zambri the son of Salomi.

verses.latin: Et clamavit Matthathias in civitate magna voce, dicens: Omnis, qui zelum habet legis, et statuta custodit, exeat post me.
verses.english: And Mattathias cried out in the city with a loud voice, saying: “Whoever has zeal for the law and keeps the statutes, let him come out after me.”

verses.latin: Et fugit ipse, et filii ejus in montana, et reliquerunt omnia, quaecumque habebant in civitate.
verses.english: And he and his sons fled into the mountains and left all that they had in the city.

verses.latin: Tunc descenderunt multi, quaerentes judicium et justitiam, ut irent in desertum.
verses.english: Then many went down, seeking judgment and justice, to go into the desert.

verses.latin: Et habitabant ibi ipsi et filii eorum, et uxores eorum, et pecora eorum: quoniam abundaverunt mala super eos.
verses.english: And they lived there, they and their sons and their wives and their livestock because evils had abounded upon them.

verses.latin: Et nuntiatus est regi Antiocho sermo iste, et iratus est, et congregavit omnem exercitum suum, et dixit: Scio, quoniam discesserunt a me Judaei, et non faciunt ea, quae volo: sed ducti sunt a me in leges suas.
verses.english: And this word was announced to King Antiochus, and he was angry, and he gathered all his army and said: “I know that the Jews have departed from me and do not do what I want, but they have been led by me into their laws.”

verses.latin: Et mittentibus ad eos exercitum, cum multitudine, ut interimerent eos.
verses.english: And he sent an army to them, with a multitude, to destroy them.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt contra illos exercitus, et appropinquaverunt ad eos, et castraverunt adversus eos, in die sabbati.
verses.english: And the army went out against them and approached them and encamped against them on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt eis: Nunc faciemus vobiscum: Exite, et facite secundum verbum regis, et vivetis.
verses.english: And they said to them: “Now we will do to you: Go out and do according to the word of the king, and you will live.”

verses.latin: Qui dixerunt: Non exibimus, nec faciemus verbum regis, nec transgrediemus diem sabbati.
verses.english: They said: “We will not go out, nor will we do the word of the king, nor will we transgress the Sabbath day.”

verses.latin: Et dederunt illis proelium cito.
verses.english: And they gave them battle quickly.

verses.latin: Et non responderunt illis, nec lapidem miserunt, nec obstruxerunt loca sua: dicentes: Moriamur omnes in innocentia nostra.
verses.english: And they did not respond to them, nor did they throw a stone, nor did they obstruct their places, saying, “Let us all die in our innocence.”

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt in eos in die sabbati.
verses.english: And they gathered against them on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et mortui sunt, cum uxoribus suis, et filiis suis, et pecoribus suis, et descendentes usque ad mille animas.
verses.english: And they died, with their wives and their sons and their livestock, and they descended to a thousand souls.

verses.latin: Et cognovit Matthathias, et amici ejus, et planxerunt illos valde.
verses.english: And Mattathias and his friends knew this and mourned them greatly.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt vir vir ad proximum suum: Si fecerimus omnes, sicut fecerunt fratres nostri, et non pugnaverimus pro animabus nostris et justificationibus nostris, et trademus in brevi omnes.
verses.english: And they said, man to his neighbor: “If we all do as our brothers did and do not fight for our souls and our justifications, we will all be surrendered in a short time.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt in die illa dicentes: Quicumque venerit ad nos in bello, in die sabbati, pugnabimus adversus eum: et non moriemur omnes, sicut morientes fratres nostri in locis occultis.
verses.english: And they resolved on that day, saying: “Whoever comes against us in battle on the Sabbath, we will fight against him, and we will not all die as our brothers died in secret places.”

verses.latin: Tunc adjunctum est illis bellum a parte Asidaei et virorum fortium de Israel, omnes qui spontanee offerebantur ad legem.
verses.english: Then war was added to them from the side of the Asidaeans and the strong men of Israel, all who willingly offered themselves to the law.

verses.latin: Et addiderunt omnes Israëlitae, qui fugiebant a malis, et auxilium eis: et confortabant eos.
verses.english: And all the Israelites who were fleeing from the evils added help to them and strengthened them.

verses.latin: Et congregata est exercitus: et percusserunt peccatores in ira sua, et viros iniquos in indignatione sua: et reliqui fugerunt in gentes, ut se conservarent.
verses.english: And the army gathered and struck the sinners in their anger and the wicked men in their indignation, and the rest fled to the Gentiles to preserve themselves.

verses.latin: Et Matthathias et amici ejus circuierunt, et destruxerunt aras.
verses.english: And Mattathias and his friends went around and destroyed the altars.

verses.latin: Et circumciderunt pueros infantes, quos invenerunt in finibus Israel, quoscumque invenerunt.
verses.english: And they circumcised the infant boys, whom they found in the borders of Israel, whoever they found.

verses.latin: Et percusserunt filios superborum.
verses.english: And they struck the sons of the arrogant.

verses.latin: Et perfecerunt opus in manu sua, et vindicaverunt in manibus gentium.
verses.english: And they completed the work with their own hand, and they took vengeance in the hands of the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et dies, quos consummaverunt, et dederunt pro lege, gloriosi sunt.
verses.english: And the days which they completed and gave for the law are glorious.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quadragesimo octavo, exierunt de Syria reges in terram Juda.
verses.english: In the one hundred and forty-eighth year, the kings left Syria and entered the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Et Judas elegit viros, et misit bellatores, et pugnavit contra eos: et occidit de eis circiter tres millia virorum.
verses.english: And Judas selected men, and sent soldiers, and fought against them: and killed about three thousand men of them.

verses.latin: Et congregatus est exercitus Judaeorum, et venerunt in Gophna: et abierunt.
verses.english: And the army of the Jews gathered, and they came to Gophna: and went away.

verses.latin: Tunc congregati sunt, et in unum venerunt adversarii Judaeorum: et exierunt in modum ascendendi in Bethsuram.
verses.english: Then the enemies of the Jews gathered, and came together as one: and went out as though to ascend to Bethsura.

verses.latin: Et audiens Judas, profectus est ipse et decem viri cum eo.
verses.english: And Judas heard, he went out with ten men with him.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt viriliter, et percusserunt de viris exercitus in modum triginta virorum: et reversi sunt.
verses.english: And they fought bravely, and struck down about thirty men of the army: and they returned.

verses.latin: Et viderunt adversarii eorum, quia irruerunt super eos Judaei, et egressi sunt de campis, et secesserunt in viam, qua erant.
verses.english: And their enemies saw that the Jews were attacking them, and went out of the fields, and withdrew to the road, where they were.

verses.latin: Et Judaei congregati sunt, et venerunt in Bethsuram: et pugnaverunt contra eos per diem.
verses.english: And the Jews gathered and came to Bethsura: and fought against them throughout the day.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt in die, et dederunt manus suis, et in eodem loco erant.
verses.english: And they rose up in the day, and gave their hands to their men, and were in the same place.

verses.latin: Et exierunt de Bethsura, et venerunt in castra Judaeorum.
verses.english: And they went out of Bethsura, and came to the camps of the Jews.

verses.latin: Et contigit in die illa, quod Achima, filius Calami, de castris Tyriorum, ingressus est.
verses.english: And it happened on that day, that Achima, son of Calami, entered from the camps of the Tyrians.

verses.latin: Et in illo loco Achima, et fratres ejus occiderunt: et caesi sunt.
verses.english: And in that place they killed Achima, and his brothers: and they were slain.

verses.latin: Et congregavit Judas et exercitus ejus, et ascenderunt in Bethsura.
verses.english: And Judas and his army gathered, and ascended to Bethsura.

verses.latin: Et posuit ibi praesidium, et mandavit eis custodire eam.
verses.english: And he placed a garrison there, and commanded them to guard it.

verses.latin: Et suscepit Judas, et elegit viros, et misit eos ad Joppen, civitatem maritimam, ut ejicerent eos qui erant ibi de populo ejus.
verses.english: And Judas took and chose men, and sent them to Joppa, a city by the sea, to cast out those who were there of his people.

verses.latin: Et veniens, sustulit portum, et occidit eos qui erant ibi: et reliquit civitatem.
verses.english: And coming, he took the port, and killed those who were there: and left the city.

verses.latin: Et cognoscentes quod Judas esset appropinquans, timuerunt: et posuerunt portas, et timuerunt.
verses.english: And knowing that Judas was approaching, they feared: and they shut the gates, and were afraid.

verses.latin: Et misit Judas, et ceperunt eos.
verses.english: And Judas sent, and they seized them.

verses.latin: Et conteruit eos qui erant in civitate, cum gladio.
verses.english: And he crushed them with the sword, those who were in the city.

verses.latin: Et suscepit Joppen, et omnes portus Judaeae, et ex tribus, et venit in Gazam.
verses.english: And he took Joppa, and all the ports of Judea, and from the tribes, and came to Gaza.

verses.latin: Et venerunt qui erant in Gaza, et clauserunt se.
verses.english: And those who were in Gaza came and shut themselves in.

verses.latin: Et obsedit eam Judas, et dedit eis praedam, et succendit muros ejus.
verses.english: And Judas besieged it, and gave them plunder, and burned its walls.

verses.latin: Et tulerunt de Gaza, et de finibus ejus, et de omnibus villis ejus quae erant in circuitu, magnum praedae.
verses.english: And they took a great amount of plunder from Gaza, and from its borders, and from all its villages that were in the surrounding area.

verses.latin: Et suscepit Judas exercitum suum, et venit in Ascalonem: et ibi, in campis, adoravit idola illorum.
verses.english: And Judas took his army, and came to Ascalon: and there, in the fields, he adored their idols.

verses.latin: Et avertit se, et abduxit exercitum suum, et exclamantes, reversi sunt in Judaeam cum magna laetitia.
verses.english: And he turned away, and led his army away, and shouting, they returned to Judea with great joy.

verses.latin: Et ascenderunt in montem Sion cum magna laetitia et gaudio: et obtulerunt holocausta, quia non perierant de hostibus eorum.
verses.english: And they ascended Mount Zion with great joy and gladness: and they offered burnt offerings, because they had not perished from their enemies.

verses.latin: Et celebrarunt purificationem templi per octo dies, et obtulerunt holocausta cum gaudio, et sacrificium pro peccato.
verses.english: And they celebrated the purification of the temple for eight days, and offered burnt offerings with joy, and sacrifice for sin.

verses.latin: Et ornaverunt templum, et atria, et sanctificaverunt atrium.
verses.english: And they adorned the temple, and the courts, and sanctified the court.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt in die vigesima quinta mensis noni, quod est Chasalew, luces.
verses.english: And they made lights on the twenty-fifth day of the ninth month, which is Chasalew.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt cum decreto, universo populo Judaeorum, ut celebrarent dies istos, per singulos annos.
verses.english: And they established by decree, to all the people of the Jews, that they should celebrate these days, every year.

verses.latin: Et in tempore illo, resurrexit Antiochus Epiphanes, et transiit in terram Persarum.
verses.english: And in that time, Antiochus Epiphanes rose up and went to the land of the Persians.

verses.latin: Et congregavit exercitum, et pugnavit contra Persas: et victus est.
verses.english: And he gathered an army, and fought against the Persians: and he was conquered.

verses.latin: Et introiens in Persidem, audivit quod esset in terra Judae commotio magna.
verses.english: And entering Persia, he heard that there was great commotion in the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et discedens a Perside, venit.
verses.english: And departing from Persia, he came.

verses.latin: Et misit Philippum, amicum suum, super Judaeos: et occidit in Jerusalem: et abstulit de eis praemium.
verses.english: And he sent Philip, his friend, over the Jews: and he killed in Jerusalem: and took away the reward from them.

verses.latin: Et in hac re, cum festinatione, accessit, et transiit per Samariam, ut perderet Judaeos.
verses.english: And in this matter, he approached with haste, and passed through Samaria, in order to destroy the Jews.

verses.latin: Et cum hoc fecisset, audivit quod Judas et fratres ejus essent prope, et congregassent exercitum, et pugnarent fortiter.
verses.english: And when he had done this, he heard that Judas and his brothers were near, and had gathered an army, and were fighting bravely.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Nunc ego dividam exercitum meum, et pugnabo contra eos, et interficiam illos.
verses.english: And he said: "Now I will divide my army, and I will fight against them, and I will kill them."

verses.latin: Et congregavit exercitum suum, et irruit, et coepit in via, in ascensum Bethoron.
verses.english: And he gathered his army, and rushed, and began on the road, on the ascent to Bethoron.

verses.latin: Et misit Judas, et exiit cum paucis, ut occurreret exercitui.
verses.english: And Judas sent, and went out with a few, to meet the army.

verses.latin: Et videntes exercitum venientem, dixit: Quoniam multi sunt, et nos pauci:
verses.english: And seeing the army coming, he said: "Because they are many, and we are few:

verses.latin: non timeamus eos: pugnemus pro animabus nostris.
verses.english: Let us not fear them: let us fight for our souls."

verses.latin: Et cum coepissent pugnare, appropinquavit de loco, et fugatus est exercitus.
verses.english: And when they began to fight, he approached from the place, and the army was routed.

verses.latin: Et qui erant in conspectu ejus, fugerunt in viam de Bethoron: et persecuti sunt illos Judaei usque in campestria, et occiderunt de eis circiter octo millia virorum.
verses.english: And those who were in his sight, fled on the road from Bethoron: and the Jews pursued them to the plains, and killed about eight thousand men of them.

verses.latin: Et exinde profecti sunt Judas et fratres ejus, et venerunt in campestria, et venerunt in Bethsuram.
verses.english: And from there, Judas and his brothers set out, and came to the plains, and came to Bethsura.

verses.latin: Et audiens Antiochus, exivit cum magna virtute, ut pugnaret contra Judaeos: et mandavit, ut pararentur praeparationes.
verses.english: And Antiochus heard, he went out with great power, to fight against the Jews: and he commanded that preparations be made.

verses.latin: Et cum exercitus ejus esset paratus, et perfectus, jussit ire in Judaeam.
verses.english: And when his army was prepared and complete, he ordered them to go into Judea.

verses.latin: Et veniens, posuit castra contra Bethsuram: et pugnavit per multos dies: et fecit machinas, et opera.
verses.english: And coming, he pitched camp against Bethsura: and fought for many days: and made machines and works.

verses.latin: Et exierunt qui erant de Bethsura, et succenderunt: et percusserunt machinas.
verses.english: And those who were from Bethsura went out and burned: and struck the machines.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt proelia magna.
verses.english: And they fought great battles.

verses.latin: Et cognovit Judas, quod venissent, et quod esset pugnatum, et coepit turbari corda eorum.
verses.english: And Judas knew that they had come, and that they were fighting, and their hearts began to be troubled.

verses.latin: Et apparuerunt cum his qui erant cum eo, ut esset ei auxilium.
verses.english: And those with him appeared, to be a help to him.

verses.latin: Et exivit in modum castrorum contra Antiochum, et pugnaverunt proelia: et ceciderunt de exercitu ejus, circiter quinque millia virorum.
verses.english: And he went out as though to the camps against Antiochus, and they fought battles: and about five thousand men fell from his army.

verses.latin: Et videns Antiochus, et exercitus ejus, quod cecidissent, reversi sunt in Judaeam cum magno dolore.
verses.english: And Antiochus and his army, seeing that they had fallen, returned to Judea with great sorrow.

verses.latin: Et suscepit Judas, et fratres ejus, et mortuos suos: et sepelierunt eos in sepulcris patrum suorum.
verses.english: And Judas and his brothers took their dead: and they buried them in the sepulchers of their fathers.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt os eorum in sepulcris patrum suorum: et celebrarunt diem vigesima quinta mensis Septembris, cum gaudio et laetitia.
verses.english: And they put their bones in the sepulchers of their fathers: and they celebrated the twenty-fifth day of the month of September, with joy and gladness.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt dies istos, in singulis annis, cum gaudio.
verses.english: And they established these days, every year, with joy.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt in monte Sion, circa templum, castra: et habitabant cum populo, cum gaudio et laetitia, et timentibus Deum.
verses.english: And they built camps on Mount Zion, around the temple: and they lived with the people, with joy and gladness, and fearing God.

verses.latin: In diebus illis surrexit Judas Machabaeus et fratres ejus, et pugnaverunt contra filios Ammon.
verses.english: In those days, Judas Maccabaeus and his brothers rose up, and fought against the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et profectus est in confinio eorum, et percussit gentem multam: et acquisivit virtutem.
verses.english: He went into their territory and defeated a large population and gained strength.

verses.latin: Et vulneravit Gedeon et eos qui erant cum eo: et venit in Galatiam, et subvertit eos.
verses.english: He wounded Gedeon and those with him. Then he came to Galilee and overthrew them.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos in campo: et abstulit spolia eorum, et gloriam eorum.
verses.english: He defeated them on the field, seized their spoils and their glory.

verses.latin: Et congregavit filios alienigenarum, et ingressus est in terram Juda.
verses.english: He gathered the sons of foreigners and entered the land of Judah.

verses.latin: Et exierunt omnes fratres ejus, et pugnaverunt contra eos: et percusserunt eos.
verses.english: All his brothers went out and fought against them, and defeated them.

verses.latin: Et incendit ignem in eorum, et in terram eorum, et abstulit spolia eorum, et gladios eorum.
verses.english: They set fire to their land and seized their spoils and their swords.

verses.latin: Et pugnavit in Galatiam, et percussit eos: et interfecit eos, et abstulit spolia eorum.
verses.english: He fought in Galilee and defeated them, and killed them and seized their spoils.

verses.latin: Et venit in confinia Samariæ: et percussit eos.
verses.english: He came to the borders of Samaria and defeated them.

verses.latin: In diebus istis venerunt filii alienigenarum, et congregati sunt ad percutiendos eos qui erant in confinio Judææ: et venerunt ad Thamnas.
verses.english: In those days, the sons of foreigners came and gathered to attack those in the territory of Judea, and they came to Thamnas.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt cum eis, et vicerunt eos: et percusserunt eos plurimos.
verses.english: They fought against them and prevailed, and killed many of them.

verses.latin: Et Joannes et Simon et Judas, fratres Judas, profecti sunt in Galilæam, et in confinia eorum.
verses.english: John, Simon, and Judas, brothers of Judas, went to Galilee and into their territory.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt, et pugnaverunt contra eos: et fugerunt ab eis, et percusserunt eos.
verses.english: They gathered and fought against them and they fled before them, and they defeated them.

verses.latin: Et collegerunt omnem potentiam eorum, cum uxoribus et filiis, et spoliis, et ingressi sunt in terram Judæ, et venerunt in Galilæam.
verses.english: They gathered all their forces with their wives and children, and their spoils, and entered the land of Judea, and came to Galilee.

verses.latin: Et Judas et fratres ejus profecti sunt in confinia eorum, et pugnaverunt.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers went to their territory and fought.

verses.latin: Et percusserunt totam virtutem eorum, ita ut multi corruerent vulnerati, et occisi sunt: et abstulerunt spolia eorum.
verses.english: They defeated their entire force so that many fell wounded and were killed, and they seized their spoils.

verses.latin: Et transierunt eos qui erant in confiniis Galilææ, et in confiniis Samariæ, et in omnes oppidos eorum: et interfecerunt eos.
verses.english: They went through those in the borders of Galilee and the borders of Samaria, and into all their towns, and killed them.

verses.latin: Et multi vulnerati ceciderunt, et occisi sunt.
verses.english: Many were wounded and killed.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt Philistim, et venerunt in terram Judæ: et fecerunt incursionem.
verses.english: The Philistines gathered and came into the land of Judah and made an incursion.

verses.latin: Et accessit Judas et fratres ejus, et percusserunt eos.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers approached and defeated them.

verses.latin: Et occiderunt in populo Philistim trium milium virorum.
verses.english: They killed three thousand men among the Philistine people.

verses.latin: Et respexit Judas, et turbas quae erant cum eo, ad eos qui corruerant, et abstulerunt arma eorum.
verses.english: Judas and his companions looked at those who had fallen and took their weapons.

verses.latin: Et insecuti sunt eos usque in Gazam, et usque in terminos Judæ: et percusserunt eos usque in Gazam et in terminos Azoti.
verses.english: They pursued them as far as Gaza and the borders of Judah, and defeated them as far as Gaza and the borders of Azotus.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in Asilon, et in terram eorum: quia habebant eorum idola, et combusserunt ea igni.
verses.english: They came to Askelon and into their land, for they had their idols, and they burned them with fire.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt in die illa de improviso qui erant in castra, et qui erant in confiniis Judææ, ad percutiendos eos.
verses.english: On that day, those who were in the camp and those in the borders of Judea rose up unexpectedly to attack them.

verses.latin: Et exivit Judas et pugnavit contra eos.
verses.english: Judas went out and fought against them.

verses.latin: Et percussit eos, et occiderunt ex eis circiter duorum milium virorum.
verses.english: He defeated them, and killed about two thousand men.

verses.latin: Et reversus est in castra, cum magna multitudine spoliis.
verses.english: He returned to the camp with a great multitude of spoils.

verses.latin: In diebus illis congregaverunt se qui erant in confiniis Judææ, et dixerunt Simon fratrem Judas.
verses.english: In those days, those in the borders of Judea gathered and said to Simon, the brother of Judas,

verses.latin: Judas et fratres ejus fecerunt res magnas, et bellum contra inimicos, et nos.
verses.english: “Judas and his brothers have done great things, and war against the enemies and us.

verses.latin: Mitte nos, et pugnabimus pro fratribus nostris.
verses.english: Send us, and we will fight for our brothers.

verses.latin: Et misit eos Simon ad pugnandum: et electi sunt, et profecti sunt cum eo.
verses.english: Simon sent them to fight and they were chosen, and they went with him.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt contra eos: et in die illa, et percusserunt eos: et fugit ab eis.
verses.english: They fought against them on that day and defeated them, and they fled before them.

verses.latin: Et persequuti sunt eos in campo, et occiderunt ex eis circiter trium milium virorum: et abstulerunt spolia eorum.
verses.english: They pursued them in the field and killed about three thousand men and seized their spoils.

verses.latin: Et duxerunt a Galilæa et Arbatta, cum uxoribus et filiis, et omnia quæ habebant: et venerunt in terram Judæ cum gaudio magno.
verses.english: They brought from Galilee and Arbatta, their wives and children, and all that they had, and came to the land of Judah with great joy.

verses.latin: Et Judas Machabaeus et fratres ejus exierunt, et venerunt in fines Idumææ, et pugnaverunt contra eos.
verses.english: Judas Maccabaeus and his brothers went out and came to the borders of Idumea and fought against them.

verses.latin: Et percusserunt fortes in eis: et obtinuerunt castra: et venerunt in eos qui erant in turri, et oppugnaverunt eos.
verses.english: They defeated the strong among them and seized the camps and attacked those who were in the tower.

verses.latin: Et obsederunt eos, et posuerunt machinas contra eos: et expugnaverunt eos, et combusserunt turrim igni, et omnes qui erant in ea.
verses.english: They besieged them, and set up machines against them, and they stormed and burned the tower with fire, and all who were in it.

verses.latin: Et transierunt contra eos, et in loco alio, et occiderunt virorum circiter viginti milia.
verses.english: They went against them in another place and killed about twenty thousand men.

verses.latin: Et cum venissent ad unam turrim, quae erat munitissima, obsederunt eam: et pugnaverunt contra eam fortiter.
verses.english: When they came to a tower, which was very fortified, they besieged it and fought against it bravely.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt ex eis, qui erant in ea, duo milia virorum: et reliquos igni combusserunt, et abstulerunt spolia eorum.
verses.english: Two thousand men fell from those who were in it, and they burned the rest with fire, and they seized their spoils.

verses.latin: Et inde profecti sunt, ut pugnarent contra filios Ammon: et invenerunt gentem potentem, et populum multum.
verses.english: From there, they set out to fight against the Ammonites, and they found a strong people and a large population.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt contra eos multum: et cecidit ex eis multi.
verses.english: They fought against them greatly, and many of them fell.

verses.latin: Et fugerunt: et percussit eos Judas, et qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: They fled and Judas and those who were with him defeated them.

verses.latin: Et dederunt oppida eorum, et reversi sunt in Judam.
verses.english: They gave up their towns and returned to Judah.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt gentes quæ erant in Galaad, contra Israël qui erant in finibus eorum.
verses.english: The Gentiles who were in Gilead gathered against Israel, who were in their borders.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt contra eos: et fugerunt in finibus eorum, et venerunt in castra.
verses.english: They fought against them and fled to their borders and came to the camps.

verses.latin: Et venerunt filii alienigenarum, et congregati sunt ut perderent eos: et ceperunt viam ad oppugnandam Sela.
verses.english: Then the sons of foreigners came together to destroy them, and they took the road to attack Sela.

verses.latin: Et exierunt de castris, et occurrerunt eis in prælium: et percusserunt eos.
verses.english: They went out from the camps and met them in battle and defeated them.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt ex eis multi vulnerati, et occisi sunt: et fugerunt reliqui in Sela.
verses.english: Many of them were wounded and killed, and the rest fled to Sela.

verses.latin: Et ceperunt castra in Galaad, et omnia quæ erant in ea: et venerunt in terram Israël.
verses.english: They seized the camps in Gilead, and all that was in them, and came to the land of Israel.

verses.latin: Et congregavit omnes Israël qui erant in Galaad, a parvo usque ad magnum, et uxores eorum, et filios, et filias, et familiam multam, valde.
verses.english: He gathered all the Israelites in Gilead, from small to great, and their wives, sons, daughters, and a very large family.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in Sela, et venerunt in castra: et adoraverunt ibi Deum magnum.
verses.english: They came to Sela, and came to the camps, and they worshipped the great God there.

verses.latin: Et Judas et fratres ejus exierunt: et pugnaverunt contra filios Esau in terra eorum ad austrum: et percussit Charracam et filios Esau, et obtinuit eos: et abstulit spolia eorum, et gladios eorum.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers went out and fought against the sons of Esau in their land to the south, and they defeated Charracam and the sons of Esau, and prevailed over them, and seized their spoils and their swords.

verses.latin: Et transierunt in Bethsuram, quæ erat civitas munita: et erat locus in quo habitabat populus.
verses.english: They went to Bethsura, which was a fortified city, and was a place where the people dwelt.

verses.latin: Et audientes quod oppugnarent civitatem, et pugnarent adversum eam, congregati sunt in unum.
verses.english: Hearing that they were attacking the city and fighting against it, they gathered together as one.

verses.latin: Et exierunt de Bethsura, et ceciderunt ex eis multi vulnerati, et occisi sunt.
verses.english: They went out from Bethsura, and many were wounded and killed among them.

verses.latin: Et Judas et fratres ejus transierunt in campum: et ecce, multitudo magna ex iis qui erant cum Joanne et qui erant cum ipso in confiniis Judææ, perierant.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers went into the field, and behold, a great multitude of those who were with John and who were with him in the borders of Judea, had perished.

verses.latin: Et doluit Judas, et fratres ejus, et dixit ad cognatos suos.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers grieved and said to their relatives:

verses.latin: Periit populus eorum: et ecce, adsumus: pugnemus.
verses.english: “Their people have perished, and here we are. Let us fight.”

verses.latin: Et congregavit omnem exercitum, et posuit illos in oratione, ad petendam pacem a Deo.
verses.english: He gathered the entire army and put them in prayer, to ask for peace from God.

verses.latin: Et exierunt cum eis, et pugnaverunt, et percusserunt eos: et vulnerati sunt multi.
verses.english: They went out with them and fought and defeated them, and many were wounded.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt mortuos suos.
verses.english: They buried their dead.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt in castra: et facta est victoria magna.
verses.english: They returned to the camp, and there was a great victory.

verses.latin: Et manserunt in Bethsura, et laudantes Altissimum.
verses.english: They remained in Bethsura, praising the Most High.

verses.latin: In diebus istis pacem habuit terra Judææ.
verses.english: In those days, the land of Judea had peace.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quinquagesimo, in mense octavo, apud Antiochiam, et ceteri exercitus ejus circumdederunt eum.
verses.english: In the year 150, in the eighth month, at Antioch, the other armies surrounded him.

verses.latin: Dilexerant enim Philippum antequam rediret, et constitutum erat cum eo, ut esset princeps regni.
verses.english: They loved Philip before he returned, and it was agreed that he would be the prince of the kingdom.

verses.latin: Idcirco festinavit, ut haberet negotium et esset paratus ad bellum. Et subito comparuit de navibus, et ingressus est in civitatem, et apprehendit eam.
verses.english: Therefore, he hurried, so that he would have a task and would be ready for war. And suddenly he appeared from the ships, and entered the city, and seized it.

verses.latin: Hoc autem audiens Demetrius, et exercitum suum congregavit, et profectus est contra eum.
verses.english: But when Demetrius heard this, he gathered his army and set out against him.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt simul, et fugatus est Philippus a civitate, et factus est fortior.
verses.english: And they fought together, and Philip was driven from the city and became stronger.

verses.latin: Et magnopere est ingemuerat Demetrius, et tunc sciebat quod prope esset perditio illi.
verses.english: And Demetrius greatly lamented, and then he knew that his ruin was near.

verses.latin: Et ivit in locum, et imperavit amicis suis: “Occidite puerum Antiochum.”
verses.english: And he went to a place and commanded his friends: “Kill the boy Antiochus.”

verses.latin: Et dedit ei, et mortuus est in die illa.
verses.english: And he gave the command, and he died that day.

verses.latin: Et misit Demetrius Nicanorem, principem equitatus, cum exercitu magno, et pugnavit adversus Judam.
verses.english: And Demetrius sent Nicanor, the leader of the cavalry, with a great army, and he fought against Judas.

verses.latin: Et nuntiaverunt genti Judae: “Ecce Nicanor venit.”
verses.english: And they announced to the people of Judah: “Behold, Nicanor is coming.”

verses.latin: Quibus auditis, contremuerunt et timuerunt; et oravit exercitus cum populo, et exclamavit, et dixit:
verses.english: Having heard this, they trembled and were afraid; and the army prayed with the people, and cried out, and said:

verses.latin: “Sancte, qui elegisti hanc domum, Domine, ut in ea invocaretur nomen tuum, miserere super eam; et immunda Nicanoris et blasphemiae ejus super te ne stabiliantur.”
verses.english: “Holy One, who has chosen this house, Lord, so that Your name may be invoked in it, have mercy upon it; and let the filthy deeds and blasphemies of Nicanor not prevail against you.”

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt; et ceciderunt de exercitu Nicanoris circiter quini millia et quingenti, et confugerunt reliqui in civitatem David.
verses.english: And they fought; and about five thousand five hundred fell from Nicanor's army, and the rest fled into the city of David.

verses.latin: Post haec autem Nicanor ascendit in montem Sion: et exierunt de sacerdotibus et senioribus de populo, salutantes eum pacifice.
verses.english: After this, however, Nicanor went up to Mount Zion: and the priests and the elders of the people came out, greeting him peacefully.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: “Non opus est de re cum rege.”
verses.english: And they said: “There is no need to speak of this matter with the king.”

verses.latin: Et Nicanor non suscepit verba eorum, et iratus juravit illis dicens:
verses.english: And Nicanor did not accept their words, and in anger he swore to them, saying:

verses.latin: “Nisi tradideritis mihi Judam et exercitum ejus, statim, si rediero in pace, succendam domum hanc.”
verses.english: “Unless you hand over to me Judas and his army immediately, if I return in peace, I will burn down this house.”

verses.latin: Et abiit Nicanor furiosus. Et ingressi sunt sacerdotes, stantes ante altare et templum, et dicentes:
verses.english: And Nicanor went away furiously. And the priests entered, standing before the altar and the temple, and saying:

verses.latin: “Tu elegisti hanc domum sanctificationis tuæ, Domine, ut in ea invocaretur nomen tuum, ut esset tibi domus orationis et obsecrationis populo tuo.
verses.english: “You chose this house for your sanctification, Lord, so that Your name may be invoked in it, that it may be for You a house of prayer and supplication for Your people.

verses.latin: Vindica iniquitates eorum, et super eos fac vindictam.”
verses.english: Avenge their iniquities, and take vengeance on them.”

verses.latin: Nicanor autem abiit de Jerusalem, et posuit castra sua in Bethoron: et occurrerunt ei de Syria exercitus.
verses.english: Now Nicanor departed from Jerusalem and placed his camp in Beth-Horon: and armies came out to meet him from Syria.

verses.latin: Et misit Judas contra eum. Et pugnaverunt in exercitu Nicanoris; et ceciderunt de exercitu ejus circiter novem millia, et vulnerati sunt et debilitati, et vulnerati in proelio.
verses.english: And Judas sent against him. And they fought in the army of Nicanor; and about nine thousand of his army fell, and were wounded and weakened, and wounded in battle.

verses.latin: Et cum hoc, reversi sunt in loca sua. Sed Nicanor remansit in civitate Hierusalem. Et erat in templo; et occidebat omnes injuriosissime.
verses.english: And with this, they returned to their places. But Nicanor remained in the city of Jerusalem. And he was in the temple; and he killed everyone very unjustly.

verses.latin: Et iratus est Nicanor, et dixit: “Nisi tradiderint mihi Judam et exercitum ejus, statim, si rediero in pace, succendam templum.”
verses.english: And Nicanor was angry, and said: “Unless they hand over to me Judas and his army, immediately, if I return in peace, I will burn the temple.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Judas: “Si tradideris eum nobis, in pace recedemus.”
verses.english: And Judas said: “If you hand him over to us, we will depart in peace.”

verses.latin: Et abiit Nicanor, et non est actum verbum. Et super hoc misit Judas nuntios, ut bellum pararet.
verses.english: And Nicanor departed, and the word was not fulfilled. And about this, Judas sent messengers to prepare for war.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt in Azota; et ceciderunt de exercitu Nicanoris circiter quinque et triginta millia virorum: et est victus Nicanor a Judaeis.
verses.english: And they fought in Azotus; and about thirty-five thousand men fell from Nicanor's army: and Nicanor was defeated by the Jews.

verses.latin: Et fugerunt Judaei de Azoto et secuti sunt Nicanorem usque ad Gazam. Et clamantes post eum, dicentes:
verses.english: And the Jews fled from Azotus and pursued Nicanor as far as Gaza. And shouting after him, saying:

verses.latin: “Quia non erunt nobis, qui impetrentur a nobis”. Et tulerunt caput Nicanoris, et manum ejus, quam extulerat, et suspenderunt eam prope turrim, et manifestam omnibus.
verses.english: “For there will not be for us those who are to be seized by us”. And they took the head of Nicanor and his hand, which he had stretched out, and they hung it near the tower, and made it known to all.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt diem unum, ut hunc diem celebrarent, id est diem victoriam. Et oraverunt et exoraverunt Dominum.
verses.english: And they established one day, so that they would celebrate this day, that is, the day of victory. And they prayed and entreated the Lord.

verses.latin: Tunc convocantes Judam, et congregantes, in civitate Hierusalem: et statuerunt ut hoc celebraturum sit annuatim die tertiadecima mensis Adar.
verses.english: Then, calling Judas, and gathering together in the city of Jerusalem: and they decided that this should be celebrated annually on the thirteenth day of the month Adar.

verses.latin: Et requievit terra Judæ per aliquantum tempus.
verses.english: And the land of Judah rested for a little while.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quinquagesimo primo, exierunt Demetrius filius Seleuci, de urbe Roma, et ascendit cum viris potentiae, et regnavit in terra regni sui.
verses.english: In the year 151, Demetrius, the son of Seleucus, departed from Rome, and came with his men of war, and began to reign in the land of his kingdom.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum egressus esset, et sedisset in sede regni sui, collegerunt sibi coronam omnes iniqui et impii de Israel.
verses.english: And when he had come into his kingdom and was seated on the throne of his reign, all the unrighteous and wicked men of Israel gathered around him.

verses.latin: Assumpserunt autem Alcimum, qui erat pontifex maximus, et voluerunt eum facere, et adduxerunt ad regem.
verses.english: They chose Alcimus, who had been High Priest, and decided to make him High Priest, and brought him to the king.

verses.latin: Et accusabant adversus populum, dicentes: Joannes et reliqui qui erant cum eo, tumultuati sunt et impulerunt populum in seditionem.
verses.english: And they accused the people, saying, "John and those who were with him have stirred up a rebellion and incited the people to revolt."

verses.latin: Quibus verbis motus rex, et ille quidem, quidam ex amicis suis, qui erant impii, et acciti, misit eos ad percutiendum Joannem.
verses.english: Moved by these words, the king, together with some of his wicked friends, summoned them to kill John.

verses.latin: Qui autem venerunt, et Joannem interfecerunt, et duos filios ejus; et misit, et interfecit filios eorum.
verses.english: Those who came killed John and his two sons, and then they killed the sons of those who had opposed them.

verses.latin: Et fecit hoc Alcimus, et cum eo omnes impii.
verses.english: And Alcimus did this, and all the wicked men with him.

verses.latin: Et congregatus est omnis populus, et iratus est; et interfecerunt eos: et constituerunt justos, et vindicaverunt.
verses.english: Then the entire people gathered, and they were angry; and they killed them, and they appointed righteous men to avenge them.

verses.latin: Et dixit Judæus: Abstulit impietas de Israel.
verses.english: Then Judea said, "Wickedness has been removed from Israel."

verses.latin: Et omnes fratres ejus, et universi qui adhaerebant illi, incolaverunt, et bellum Israhel, et in diebus illis.
verses.english: Then all of his brothers and those who were with him settled in the area, and they fought Israel during those days.

verses.latin: Et exierunt filii iniquitatis de Israel, et quaesierunt omnes iniquos, et abierunt, et tulerunt de maledictionem de medio eorum.
verses.english: Then the wicked men of Israel went out and sought all the wicked, and they went away, and took the evil from among them.

verses.latin: Et in die illa, factum est bellum, et percussit Judæus.
verses.english: And on that day, there was war, and Judas struck them down.

verses.latin: Et cum vidisset, Jason iniquitatem in Israel, et amicos suos, et venientes, ad irridendos eos, et ad promeridiem, fugit in regione Ammonitarum.
verses.english: When Jason saw the wickedness in Israel, and his friends who came to mock them, he fled to the region of the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et posuit contra fines populi, duces, et congregavit ad eos, et percussit eos, et in loco malorum eorum, et percusserunt filios Israel.
verses.english: He placed leaders against the borders of the people, and gathered them against them, and struck them down, and in the place of their evils, and they struck down the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt filii alienorum, et venierunt ad percutiendum de Judæa, et abierunt de terra sua.
verses.english: Then the sons of the strangers gathered together, and they came to attack Judea, and they went away from their own land.

verses.latin: Et dixit Simon, et fratres ejus: In diebus nostris, in diebus adversariorum nostrorum, eximus de terra nostra.
verses.english: Then Simon and his brothers said, "In our days, in the days of our adversaries, we have gone forth from our land."

verses.latin: Et congregavit Judæus omnes, et dixit: Ecce ego et fratres mei, et domus patris mei, et bellamus pro legibus et sancta.
verses.english: And Judas gathered everyone together, and said, "Behold, I and my brothers, and the house of my father, we fight for the laws and the holy places."

verses.latin: Et omnes propterea, conciderunt in bellum.
verses.english: And all, because of this, rushed into battle.

verses.latin: Et dixit, et omnes gentes timuerunt eum.
verses.english: And he spoke, and all the nations feared him.

verses.latin: Et audivit Demetrius, et congregavit copias suas, et abiit in bellum in Judæa.
verses.english: Then Demetrius heard, and gathered his forces, and went to war in Judea.

verses.latin: Et misit Nicanorem, ducem exercitus sui, et percussit Judæos.
verses.english: And he sent Nicanor, the commander of his army, to strike down the Jews.

verses.latin: Et cum appropinquaret Hierusalem, et vidit exercitum Judæorum, timuit.
verses.english: And when he approached Jerusalem, and saw the army of the Jews, he was afraid.

verses.latin: Et timuit congressus, et dimicatio cum filiis Israël, et reverti voluit.
verses.english: And he feared the battle, and the fighting with the sons of Israel, and he wanted to return.

verses.latin: Et Nicanor blasphemabat et jurabat, dicens: Si non tradantur Judæi in manus meas, et ego dispergam templum, et veniens incolam illic.
verses.english: And Nicanor blasphemed and swore, saying, "Unless the Jews are handed over into my hands, I will destroy the temple, and I will come and dwell there."

verses.latin: Et Judæus audivit verba Nicanoris, et congressus est; et non timuit. Et dimicavit cum exercitu Nicanoris.
verses.english: And Judas heard the words of Nicanor, and he entered battle; and he was not afraid. And he fought against the army of Nicanor.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt de exercitu Nicanoris circiter quinque millia virorum.
verses.english: And about five thousand men fell from the army of Nicanor.

verses.latin: Et fugit Nicanor ante faciem exercitus Judæorum, et percussus est.
verses.english: And Nicanor fled before the face of the army of the Jews, and he was struck down.

verses.latin: Et audientes qui erant in Judæa, Nicanorem cecidisse, projecerunt lapides ad eos, et percusserunt eos.
verses.english: And those who were in Judea, hearing that Nicanor had fallen, threw stones at them, and struck them.

verses.latin: Et dimiserunt eos, et inciderunt in proxima castra eorum.
verses.english: And they released them, and attacked their nearest camps.

verses.latin: Et facto hoc, et congregati, et percusserunt Nicanorem in die sabbati.
verses.english: And after doing this, they gathered and struck down Nicanor on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt arma eorum, et reliquias eorum, et capita eorum, super arborem, et ostenderunt eam.
verses.english: And they placed their weapons, and their remains, and their heads, on a tree, and showed them.

verses.latin: Et omnes consenserunt, et juraverunt, dicentes: Benedictus Dominus, qui servavit populum suum, et percusserunt impium Nicanorem, in die illa.
verses.english: And all agreed, and swore, saying, "Blessed be the Lord, who has saved his people, and struck down the impious Nicanor, on that day."

verses.latin: Et celebraverunt diem quintumdecimum mensis Adar, et in die eodem, in diebus Nicanoris, et usque in hodiernum diem.
