verses.english: And they celebrated the fifteenth day of the month Adar, and on the same day, the days of Nicanor, and even to this present day.

verses.latin: Et sic dictum est de civitate Hierusalem: De diebus Nicanoris, et usque in hodiernum diem.
verses.english: And thus it was said about the city of Jerusalem: "From the days of Nicanor, and even to this present day."

verses.latin: Et hoc finis est de Nicanore. Et postquam audivit Demetrius, misit iterum Bacchidem, et Alcimum in Judæam.
verses.english: And this is the end of Nicanor. And after Demetrius heard, he again sent Bacchides and Alcimus into Judea.

verses.latin: Et praestantissimum bellatorum, et tradidit ei multitudinem exercitus, et abiit in terram Judæ.
verses.english: He gave him a very strong army and went into the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et festinavit Bacchides, et venit, et percussit in die sabbati, et locutus est, et occidit multos.
verses.english: And Bacchides hurried and came, and struck them on the Sabbath, and spoke and killed many.

verses.latin: Et dixit Judæus: Quare, quare, egressi sumus? Et congregati sunt ad eum.
verses.english: And Judas said: "Why, why have we come forth?" And they gathered around him.

verses.latin: Et dixit Bacchides: Modo, ecce ego, et populus meus, et percutiam, et occidam illos.
verses.english: And Bacchides said: "Now, behold me and my people, I will strike and kill them."

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt de Hierusalem, et venerunt ad Casalem, et percusserunt illos.
verses.english: And they went out from Jerusalem, and came to Casalem, and struck them.

verses.latin: Et percusserunt ex die illa, et ceciderunt de eis, circiter quindecim viri.
verses.english: And from that day they struck them, and about fifteen men fell from them.

verses.latin: Et recessit Judæus, et omnes cum eo.
verses.english: And Judas withdrew, and all those with him.

verses.latin: Et congregavit Bacchides, et adduxit viros suos.
verses.english: And Bacchides gathered together and brought his men.

verses.latin: Et venit in terram Judæ, et percussit.
verses.english: And he came into the land of Judea, and struck them.

verses.latin: Et exierunt omnes ex Hierusalem, et fecerunt cum eis, et occiderunt multos de populo.
verses.english: And all went out from Jerusalem, and they did the same with them, and they killed many of the people.

verses.latin: Et reversus est Bacchides, et posuit castra in Azed, et aedificavit civitates munitas in Judæa: munitionem in Jericho, et in Emmaus, et in Bethoron, et in Bethel, et Thamnas, et Phara, et Thephon, et in civitatibus quae erant in Judæa.
verses.english: And Bacchides returned, and set up camp in Azed, and built fortified cities in Judea: a fortress in Jericho, and in Emmaus, and in Bethoron, and in Bethel, and Thamnas, and Phara, and Thephon, and in the cities that were in Judea.

verses.latin: Et posuit in eis, custodes, et munivit eas, et thesaurizavit cibaria, et congregavit in eis bellatores.
verses.english: And he placed guards in them, and fortified them, and stored provisions, and gathered soldiers in them.

verses.latin: Et cum filiis Israel, et qui erant in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And with the sons of Israel, and those who were in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt, et ad Hierusalem, et custodiebant civitatem usque ad mortem.
verses.english: And they gathered, and came to Jerusalem, and guarded the city until death.

verses.latin: Et clamaverunt in civitate Hierusalem, et exclamabat vox eorum ad caelum.
verses.english: And they cried out in the city of Jerusalem, and their voice cried out to heaven.

verses.latin: Erat autem audita res Romanorum, quia fortissimi essent, et praestarent omnibus gentibus, quibuscum bellum gererent.
verses.english: The news about the Romans was heard, that they were very strong, and were better than all the other nations, even those they fought with.

verses.latin: Et quia omnes, quos ad se attulerant, in amicitiam receperant, et cum eis pacem faciebant, et quoniam potentes essent.
verses.english: And because they had brought all the peoples to themselves, they received them into friendship, and made peace with them, and because they were powerful.

verses.latin: Et audierunt de bellis eorum, et de virtutibus, quas faciebant in Galatia, quomodo eos vicissent, et subegerant eos.
verses.english: They heard about their wars, and the acts of valor they did in Galatia, how they had conquered them, and subdued them.

verses.latin: Et quanta in provinciis, et in aliis gentibus, vicissent, et omnes eos in amicitiam receperant.
verses.english: And how much they had conquered in the provinces, and in other nations, and that they had received all of them into friendship.

verses.latin: Et de bellis, quae fecerant cum Philippo rege, et cum Perse, rege Macedonum, et de reliquis gentibus, quae contra eos pugnaverant.
verses.english: And about the wars, which they had waged with King Philip, and with Perseus, King of the Macedonians, and with the remaining nations that had fought against them.

verses.latin: Et quoniam hi, qui superaverant, cum eis in bellum venerant, et ipsi obtulerant pacem.
verses.english: And because those whom they had conquered had come with them into battle, and had offered peace themselves.

verses.latin: Et bellum, quod fecerant in Galatia, et quomodo subegerant eos, et adduxerant eos sub tributum.
verses.english: And the war, which they waged in Galatia, and how they subdued them, and brought them under tribute.

verses.latin: Et quanta in terra eorum fecerant, et quomodo eos subegerant.
verses.english: And how much they had done in their land, and how they had subdued them.

verses.latin: Et de rebus, quae audiebantur de eis, quod essent viri fortissimi, et amicis suis benigne afficerentur, et cum his, qui se colebant, societatem facerent.
verses.english: And about the things that were heard about them, that they were very strong men, and were kindly disposed towards their friends, and made an alliance with those who cultivated them.

verses.latin: Igitur Judas et fratres ejus placuerunt Romanis, et miserunt ad eos, in amicitiam, et societatem faciendam, et ut essent auxilium illis.
verses.english: Therefore, Judas and his brothers pleased the Romans, and sent to them, to make friendship, and an alliance, and to be a help to them.

verses.latin: Et accepta est res a Romanis.
verses.english: And the matter was accepted by the Romans.

verses.latin: Miserunt itaque senatores Romani ad populum Judaeorum litteras hujuscemodi.
verses.english: Therefore, the Roman senators sent letters of this kind to the people of the Jews.

verses.latin: Romanis et populo Judaeorum, salutem et prosperitatem.
verses.english: To the Romans and to the people of the Jews, greetings and prosperity.

verses.latin: Si in bello contra vos congressi fuerimus, primum vos in auxilium sumemus.
verses.english: If we are engaged in war against you, we will first take you as an aid.

verses.latin: Si autem vos bellum contra nos suscepereitis, nos vobis in bello subveniemus.
verses.english: But if you undertake a war against us, we will assist you in the war.

verses.latin: Testes sunt haec litterae, in Romanis, in primis.
verses.english: The Romans are witnesses to these letters, first of all.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad Hierusalem, ad populum Judaeorum, litteras hujuscemodi.
verses.english: And they sent letters of this kind to Jerusalem, to the people of the Jews.

verses.latin: Judas et fratribus ejus, et genti Judaeorum, salutem et prosperitatem.
verses.english: To Judas and his brothers, and to the nation of the Jews, greetings and prosperity.

verses.latin: Miserunt nobis legatos, ad amicitiam, et societatem faciendum: suscepimus ergo eos.
verses.english: They sent us ambassadors to make friendship, and an alliance: so we received them.

verses.latin: Decrevimus ergo scribere vobis.
verses.english: Therefore, we decided to write to you.

verses.latin: Si ergo in terra nostra bellum vobis intenderint, pugnabimus pro vobis, quamdiu necessarium fuerit.
verses.english: Therefore, if anyone intends war against you in our land, we will fight for you, for as long as is necessary.

verses.latin: Et si vobis bellum intenderint, nos, similiter, pugnabimus pro vobis.
verses.english: And if they intend war against you, we will similarly fight for you.

verses.latin: Miserunt igitur litteras, ad haec, Romanis.
verses.english: Therefore, they sent the letters to this effect, to the Romans.

verses.latin: In anno centesimo quadragesimo sexto, et initium fuit in his, quae Judaei, et qui erant Hierosolymis, miserunt ad Romanos, ut esset eis amicitia et societas.
verses.english: In the one hundred and forty-sixth year, and the beginning was in these matters, which the Jews, and those who were in Jerusalem, sent to the Romans, so that there might be friendship and alliance for them.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in diebus illis, Antiochus cum exercitu revertens ex Persarum regione, venit in civitatem Antiochiam.
verses.english: During this time, Antiochus returned with his army from Persia and came into the city of Antioch.

verses.latin: Et cum introisset, tulit Lysiam, primum ministrorum suorum, et mandavit ei, ut duceret copias, et iret in Judaeam, et perderet eam.
verses.english: After entering, he took Lysias, the first of his ministers, and commanded him to lead an army, go to Judea, and destroy it.

verses.latin: Et misit ei copias, et electos viros, et regum praepositos, cum eis: et abiit cum viribus, et venit, et appropinquavit Judaeae, juxta Emmaum.
verses.english: He sent him with troops, chosen men, and the king's officials. Lysias went with the army and came near Judea, near Emmaus.

verses.latin: Et audierunt Judaei congregationem eorum: et congregati sunt, et posuerunt secum Agathonem, et Judeum, viros strenuos, et lectos ad pugnam.
verses.english: The Jews heard about their gathering. They gathered and placed with them Agathon and Judeus, brave men chosen for the fight.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum vidissent copias, timuerunt, et egressi sunt de castris.
verses.english: When they saw the army, they were afraid and went out of the camp.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt hi, qui erant cum Lysia, ad pugnam: et ceciderunt de exercitu eorum quasi quingenti viri.
verses.english: The men with Lysias went to battle, and about five hundred men fell from their army.

verses.latin: Et viderunt, quod corruissent copiae eorum, et reversi sunt in castra.
verses.english: They saw that their forces had fallen and retreated to their camp.

verses.latin: Judas autem et fratres ejus viderunt quod imminuissent mali, et ascenderunt contra eos.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers saw that the wicked had diminished in strength, so they went against them.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt, et percusserunt ex eis viros circiter octo millia.
verses.english: They fought and killed about eight thousand men.

verses.latin: Et disperserunt reliquos in castris: et exierunt omnes in fuga.
verses.english: They scattered the rest in the camp, and all fled.

verses.latin: Quod audiens Judas, coepit viriliter, et animo fortificatus, delectorum virorum, mittens ad bellum.
verses.english: Judas, hearing this, began to act bravely and, with a fortified spirit, sent chosen men to war.

verses.latin: Sed et Simon cum exercitu venit contra Bethsuram, et dimicabat diu, et oppugnabat eam.
verses.english: Simon also came with an army against Bethsura, and he fought and besieged it for a long time.

verses.latin: Et non potuit obtinere eam.
verses.english: But he was not able to capture it.

verses.latin: Et Lysias audiens quod Judas et fratres ejus, viros fortissimos, fecissent, et populo universae multitudinis, et omni virtuti, quod conglobassentur ad eos.
verses.english: Lysias heard that Judas and his brothers, very strong men, had done this, and that the entire multitude of the people and all their forces were gathering around them.

verses.latin: Et timuit valde, et cogitavit ut iret in Galilaeam, antequam pugnaret adversus eos.
verses.english: He was very afraid and considered going to Galilee before fighting against them.

verses.latin: Et paratus est, et venit in regionem Galilaeae.
verses.english: He prepared and came into the region of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et Judas cum eo: et universus populus, et parati erant ad bellum.
verses.english: Judas was with him, as was all the people, and they were ready for battle.

verses.latin: Et cum irruisset in eos, et congrediebantur, fugerunt.
verses.english: When they rushed upon them and engaged, they fled.

verses.latin: Et omnes, qui erant in castris, fugerunt in finibus.
verses.english: All those in the camp fled to the borders.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt de castris eorum, gladiis, circa tria millia virorum.
verses.english: About three thousand men fell by the sword from their camp.

verses.latin: Judas autem persecutus est eos.
verses.english: Judas pursued them.

verses.latin: Et revertit in castra.
verses.english: And he returned to the camp.

verses.latin: Tunc Judas in Galilaea congregavit eos, et dimicavit contra eos usque dum expugnavit totam Galilaeam.
verses.english: Then Judas gathered them in Galilee and fought against them until he conquered all of Galilee.

verses.latin: Et Joannem, qui vocabatur Esceneus, venientem ex castris.
verses.english: And John, who was called Esceneus, coming from the camp,

verses.latin: Et Judas et fratres ejus ascenderunt in montem, et pugnaverunt.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers went up to the mountain and fought.

verses.latin: Et occiderunt Simonem et fratres ejus, et Joannem.
verses.english: They killed Simon and his brothers, and John.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt in castris: et cum audissent, venientes cum multis viris, et fuerunt ibi pernoctantes, et percusserunt.
verses.english: And they gathered in the camp, and when they heard, they came with many men. They stayed there through the night and struck.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum audisset Jonathan, et Simon, secesserunt, et cum eis qui erant cum illis, in desertum Thecoe, et castrametati sunt juxta aquam castri. Et miserunt ad eos de castris in Thecoe.
verses.english: When Jonathan and Simon heard this, they retreated with those who were with them to the desert of Thecoe and camped near the water of the camp. They sent men to them from the camp in Thecoe.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum audissent Jonathan, reversi sunt, et percusserunt in castris: et ceciderunt ex eis multi.
verses.english: And when Jonathan heard, they turned back and struck in the camp; and many of them fell.

verses.latin: Et Simon, et qui erant cum eo, egressi sunt, et apposuerunt ad pugnam, et dissipaverunt ea, et percusserunt.
verses.english: Simon and those with him went out, joined the battle, and scattered and struck them down.

verses.latin: Et Jonathan, cum fratribus suis, et cum suis, in castris: exierunt in pugnam, et percusserunt.
verses.english: And Jonathan, with his brothers and his own men, went into the camp to battle and struck.

verses.latin: Et Jonathan et qui erant cum eo, in civitate, et in civitate, et mortui sunt, qui erant ibi.
verses.english: And Jonathan and those with him, in the city, and in the city, and those who were there died.

verses.latin: Et exierunt, et percusserunt, et caeperunt omnia, quae erant in ea.
verses.english: And they went out, struck, and captured everything in it.

verses.latin: Et factum est in die prima, et erant circa duo millia virorum: et in die secunda, erant circa quatuor millia.
verses.english: And it came to pass on the first day, there were about two thousand men; and on the second day, there were about four thousand.

verses.latin: Et videns Jonathan, et qui erant cum eo, pugnaverunt contra eos, et exierunt illi cum suis, et cum multis viris: et extenderunt manus suas, et percusserunt.
verses.english: And seeing Jonathan and those who were with him, they fought against them, and they went out with their own, and with many men, and extended their hands and struck.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt de eis circa octo millia virorum.
verses.english: And about eight thousand men fell from them.

verses.latin: Et Jonathan et qui erant cum eo, reversi sunt, et ceperunt spolia eorum.
verses.english: And Jonathan and those with him returned and took their spoils.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum reverteretur, et venit in Antiochiam, congregavit Lysias, et dedit in consilio viris sapientibus sententiam.
verses.english: When he returned and came to Antioch, Lysias gathered and gave the opinion in council to the wise men.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt, quod non deberet esse amplius, et dimitteret eos: et statuerunt ut remittant eos, et secedant a finibus eorum.
verses.english: And they said that it should not happen anymore and that he should release them. They decreed that they should release them and depart from their borders.

verses.latin: Et factum est ut in anno illo, egressus est Judas et fratres ejus, et elegerunt viros, et miserunt Romam, ad faciendam cum eis amicitiam et confederationem: et ut amoverent a se jugum, et cum ipsi Macedones.
verses.english: And it came to pass that in that year, Judas and his brothers went out, chose men, and sent them to Rome to make friendship and alliance with them, and to remove the yoke from themselves and the Macedonians.

verses.latin: Et placuit eis sermo, et praeceperunt viros qui missi sunt, ut facerent cum eis amicitiam.
verses.english: And the word pleased them, and they commanded the men who were sent to make friendship with them.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad Judam, et fratres ejus litteras, dicentes: Populo Judaeorum, et fratribus, salutem: et amicitiam, et auxilium.
verses.english: And they sent letters to Judas and his brothers, saying: "To the people of the Jews and their brothers, greetings, friendship, and help.

verses.latin: Et factum est, et statuerunt ut darent eis auxiliam et secederent a regno Macedonum.
verses.english: And it came to pass, and they decreed that they would give them help and depart from the kingdom of the Macedonians.

verses.latin: Et scripserunt in tabulis aereis, et miserunt Romam, ut esset cum eis memoria amicitiae: et cum Judaeis.
verses.english: And they wrote on bronze tablets and sent them to Rome, so that there would be a memorial of the friendship with them and with the Jews.

verses.latin: Et factum est, post haec, misit Antiochus in regionem Persarum, et congregavit exercitum multum.
verses.english: And it came to pass, after these things, that Antiochus sent to the region of Persia and gathered a large army.

verses.latin: Et abiit in Persidem, et erant cum eo, qui credebant in virtutibus.
verses.english: And he went into Persia, and those who believed in his power were with him.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in civitatem, quae vocabatur Elymaidis, et voluit accipere templum, et custodire civitatem.
verses.english: They came to the city called Elymais and wanted to take the temple and guard the city.

verses.latin: Et non potuerunt, quoniam revelatum est eis consilium civitatis.
verses.english: But they could not, because the plan of the city was revealed to them.

verses.latin: Et eiecerunt eos, et hi, qui erant in civitate.
verses.english: And those in the city drove them out.

verses.latin: Et factum est, reverterunt in Babyloniam, et factum est, iterum.
verses.english: And it came to pass that they returned to Babylonia again.

verses.latin: Et venit ei nuntius in Perside, quod fugerant exercitus qui erant in Judaea.
verses.english: And a messenger came to him in Persia, saying that the armies that were in Judea had fled.

verses.latin: Et exierunt, qui missi fuerant ad pugnam, a Judaeis, et dispersi sunt in castris.
verses.english: And those who had been sent to battle by the Jews had gone out and were scattered in the camps.

verses.latin: Et cogitavit Antiochus ut in Judaeam, statim veniret, et posuit se proficisci, et cum ira omnia parare.
verses.english: And Antiochus considered that he would come immediately into Judea and decided to set out and prepare everything with anger.

verses.latin: Et cum hoc diceret, et factum est, continuo plagatus est, et dimissus est: et cecidit in montibus.
verses.english: And while he was saying this, it happened that he was struck immediately and released. He fell on the mountains.

verses.latin: Et receperunt eum, et erat in lecto paralyticus.
verses.english: And they received him, and he was on a bed, paralyzed.

verses.latin: Et moriebatur, et exclamavit, cognoscens, et dixit: Mortuus sum in miseria magna.
verses.english: And he was dying, and he cried out, recognizing, and said: "I am dying in great misery.

verses.latin: Cum autem moreretur, et audivit quod in Perside, milites dispersi essent, et persequentibus eos, et occisus esset.
verses.english: And as he was dying, he heard that the soldiers in Persia had been scattered, and that they were being pursued and killed.

verses.latin: Et cum audisset verbum, exclamavit: Ego eam, et vadeo, omnes mei: et abiit in Persidem, et moriebatur.
verses.english: And when he heard the word, he cried out: "I go, and I depart, all of mine." And he went into Persia and died.

verses.latin: Et sepelierunt eum: et in loco ejus regnavit filius ejus Antiochus.
verses.english: And they buried him, and his son Antiochus reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo sexagesimo, Simon frater Jonathae, a principio sacerdotem magnum se constituit, et in locum Jonathae fratris sui successit.
verses.english: In the one hundred and sixtieth year, Simon, the brother of Jonathan, declared himself to be High Priest, succeeding his brother Jonathan.

verses.latin: In diebus illis, pugnabat Judas cum gentibus.
verses.english: In those days, Judas was fighting against the Gentiles.

verses.latin: Et congregatus est populus in Israël.
verses.english: And the people of Israel gathered together.

verses.latin: Videns autem Simon, quod requireret populus, et timorem haberet, operatus est.
verses.english: Seeing that the people were seeking and in fear, Simon took action.

verses.latin: Et elegit viros, et misit illos ad Demetrium regem, ut indigeret remittere eis, quae fecerant Judaei, et quae fecerant in terra, et ut dimitteret eos, qui erant in terra Judaeae.
verses.english: And he chose men and sent them to King Demetrius, to ask him to withdraw the decrees he had issued against the Jews, and against the land of Judea, and to release those who were held captive in the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et misit illis Demetrius rex, secundum verba, quae dixit illi, et honoravit eum.
verses.english: And King Demetrius sent them, according to the words he had spoken to them, and honored him.

verses.latin: Et scripsit epistolas Judaeis, tales dicens: Rex Demetrius populo Judaeorum, salutem.
verses.english: And he wrote letters to the Jews, saying: “King Demetrius to the people of the Jews, greetings.”

verses.latin: Quoniam memoriam vestram, Judaeorum, et amicorum vestrorum, custodimus, et secundum eos, qui vobiscum sunt, constituimus, et ea, quae fecerunt vobis, accepimus.
verses.english: “Because we remember you, the Jews, and your friends, and have made arrangements in accordance with them, and have received what you have done for us.”

verses.latin: Ideo ergo judicavimus vobis et aliis Judaeis dicentes: Quicumque ex Judaea, qui usque ad diem hanc venerint ad nos, pacem habeant, et sine molestia.
verses.english: “Therefore, we have judged it right to write to you and the other Jews, saying: 'All those from Judea who come to us up to this day, let them have peace, and be without any trouble.'

verses.latin: Et omnes Judaeos, qui abierunt de terra vestra usque ad diem hanc, constituimus immunes, et ex omni tributo terrae.
verses.english: “And we declare all the Jews who have departed from your land up to this day, to be free from taxation and from all the tributes of the land.

verses.latin: De quibus etiam tributis, et tributis salis, et coronis, quae ad nos pertinebant, abdicamus omnia, et damus vobis et aliis Judaeis.
verses.english: “Concerning all the tributes, and the salt tax, and the crown taxes which belonged to us, we release all of them and give them to you and the other Jews.

verses.latin: Et quicumque ex vobis scripti sunt in libris, in hominibus nostris, sint vobis, et quicumque ex vobis sunt usque ad diem hanc, vobiscum sint.
verses.english: “And anyone of you who is inscribed in our books, let them be your people, and those of you who have come to this day, let them be with you.

verses.latin: Et mando Alexandrino, et quibuscumque officiariis meis: Ut praestent vobis haec, et quia pacem vestram statuerunt.
verses.english: “And I command the Alexandrians and all my officials: To assist you in these matters, and to establish your peace.

verses.latin: Et quae constituerunt vobis Judaei, ad usque hunc diem, statui et ego. Et de tributis, quae dabant in diebus prioribus, abstuli.
verses.english: “And what the Jews have determined for you up to this day, I also establish. And I have removed the taxes which they paid in the earlier days.”

verses.latin: Et haec, quae scribo vobis, facio et vobis et aliis Judaeis, et constitui omnem pacem, et in terra vestra.
verses.english: “And these things I write to you, I do for you and the other Jews, and I establish all peace in your land.”

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quinquagesimo et quarto, abierunt Judaei, qui erant in Judaea, filii Israël, qui erant in captivitate, et redierunt, et aedificaverunt.
verses.english: In the one hundred and fifty-fourth year, the Jews in Judea, the sons of Israel who were in captivity, departed and returned and rebuilt.

verses.latin: Et coronaverunt montem Sion, et in ea, qui erant cum eis.
verses.english: And they crowned Mount Zion, and those who were with them.

verses.latin: Et filii Alexandri, qui erant in Macedonia, venerunt, et constituerunt Ptolemaeum regem.
verses.english: And the sons of Alexander, who were in Macedonia, came and established Ptolemy as king.

verses.latin: Et misit rex Ptolemaeus, Simonem sacerdotem magnum, ut daret ei honorem.
verses.english: And King Ptolemy sent to Simon the High Priest, to give him honor.

verses.latin: Et fecit hoc. Et constituit eum, et amicam suam, et dedit ei multa, et confirmavit cum eis, et constituerunt eum principem sacerdotum, et omnia, quae illi spectabant.
verses.english: And he did this. And he appointed him and his friends, and gave him many gifts, and confirmed his friendship with them, and appointed him as High Priest, and for all things that pertained to him.

verses.latin: Et acceperunt civitatem, quae nominatur Gazara, et Ptolemaeus, et Simon.
verses.english: And they captured the city called Gazara, Ptolemy and Simon.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt contra eam multum, et posuerunt illam in igne, et diripuerunt omnem praedam ejus.
verses.english: And they fought against it a great deal, and they set it on fire, and plundered all its spoils.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt habitatores Gazarae, et extinxerunt omnem pestem ejus.
verses.english: And they put to death the inhabitants of Gazara, and exterminated all the wickedness there.

verses.latin: Et venerunt Judaei cum Simone in Jerusalem, et purgaverunt eam, et expulerunt omne immundum, et fecerunt in ea habitatores bonos.
verses.english: And the Jews came with Simon to Jerusalem, and they purified it, and cast out all that was unclean, and they made good inhabitants there.

verses.latin: Et in die vigesima tertia secundi mensis, anno centesimo septuagesimo et uno, ingressi sunt in eam cum laude et palmis, et citharis, et cymbals, et psalteriis, et hymnis, et canticis.
verses.english: And on the twenty-third day of the second month, in the one hundred and seventy-first year, they entered it with praise and palms, and with lyres, cymbals, psalteries, hymns and canticles.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt diem singulis annis, ut facerent eam diem laetitiae.
verses.english: And they established a day each year, so that they would celebrate this day as a day of joy.

verses.latin: Et statuerunt terram Judaeae, et sacerdotium, et populum, et praesidia, et arma, et civitates, et omnia opera, quae habebantur, in Judaea.
verses.english: And they established the land of Judea, and the priesthood, and the people, and the garrisons, and the weapons, and the cities, and all the works that were in Judea.

verses.latin: Et dixit Simon, ad se ipsum, et ad amicos suos: Quod, si de hac parte, qui erant ad nos, pugnaverunt, et si hostes venerunt, non poterimus resistere, eo quod bellum.
verses.english: And Simon said to himself and to his friends: “Because if those on our side fight, and if enemies come, we will not be able to resist, because of the war.”

verses.latin: Et constituit in Judaea, et aedificavit in Jerico, et in Galilaea, et in Asor, et in Emmanuel, et in Bethsura, et in Beth-leem, et in omnia loca, quae munivit.
verses.english: And he established Judea, and built in Jericho, and in Galilee, and in Hazor, and in Emmanuel, and in Bethsura, and in Bethlehem, and in all the places which he fortified.

verses.latin: Et munivit ea, et posuit in eis praesidia, et thesaurizavit in eis commeatum.
verses.english: And he fortified them, and placed garrisons in them, and stored provisions in them.

verses.latin: Et congregavit Simon omnes viros bellatores, et posuit praesidia, et thesaurizavit in eis arma.
verses.english: And Simon gathered all the men of war, and placed garrisons, and stored weapons in them.

verses.latin: Et cum eo pacem fecerunt Joannes, et omnes, qui erant in Judaea.
verses.english: And John and all those who were in Judea made peace with him.

verses.latin: Et vidit populus, quod Simon laborabat pro salute sua, et dederunt ei honorem et gloriam.
verses.english: And the people saw that Simon was working for their salvation, and they gave him honor and glory.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt eum principem, et sacerdotem magnum, et fecerunt ei amicitias, et omnes Judaei.
verses.english: And they made him a leader and High Priest, and all the Jews made him their friend.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt eum, et quod ipse praesidet omnibus, et omnibus negotiis terrae, et armis.
verses.english: And they declared him to be in charge of all, and of all the affairs of the land, and of the weapons.

verses.latin: Et audivit Simon, quod Romani audissent de gentibus, quod audissent quia ipsi potentiores sunt, et concordant omnia, quae illis praecipiuntur.
verses.english: And Simon heard that the Romans had heard from the Gentiles, that they had heard that they were more powerful, and they agreed to everything that was commanded to them.

verses.latin: Et dederunt amicitias Simonis, et acciperunt societatem ipsius.
verses.english: And they gave their friendship to Simon, and they accepted his alliance.

verses.latin: Et miserunt illis, et constituerunt ei scutum aureum, et dederunt ei honorem, et in eo, ut esset cum illis.
verses.english: And they sent to them, and established for him a golden shield, and gave him honor, so that he might be with them.

verses.latin: Et audivit populus, haec verba, et dixerunt: Quomodo dabimus illi honorem?
verses.english: And the people heard these words, and said: “How shall we give him honor?

verses.latin: Et constituerunt ut facerent ei magnam laudationem, et ut facerent illi honorem, et gloriaretur.
verses.english: And they resolved to give him a great praise, and to honor him, and to glorify him.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt omnes Judaei: Et constituerunt illum principem et sacerdotem magnum in sempiternum, donec surgeret propheta fidelis.
verses.english: And all the Jews did this: And they made him a leader and High Priest forever, until a faithful prophet should arise.

verses.latin: Et praeerat Judaeis, et sacerdotibus omnibus, et omnibus populis.
verses.english: And he was in charge of the Jews, and all the priests, and all the people.

verses.latin: Et insuper omnes negotia terrae, et bellorum, et arma, et civitates, et omnia opera.
verses.english: And furthermore, all the affairs of the land, and the wars, and the weapons, and the cities, and all the works.

verses.latin: Et constituissent in eo omnia, sicut antea.
verses.english: And they established in him all things, as before.

verses.latin: Et laetati sunt omnes populi in operibus ejus.
verses.english: And all the people rejoiced in his works.

verses.latin: Et sicut operatus est Simon cum honore et gloria, in terra et in Jerusalem, ita constituit omnes populos in pace.
verses.english: And as Simon worked with honor and glory, in the land and in Jerusalem, so he established all the peoples in peace.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quinquagesimo, et primo, ex quo factum est regnum Graecorum, exierunt Romani ad Ptolemaeum, regem Aegypti, dicentes, ut daret illis auxilium, et tolleret eos de terra.
verses.english: In the one hundred and fiftieth year of the kingdom of the Greeks, the Romans went to Ptolemy, the king of Egypt, saying that he should give them help and take them out of the land.

verses.latin: Rex autem Ptolemaeus respondit: Ego sum rex Aegypti, et veni ad terram meam, et dedi eis auxilium, et reddidi civitatem terram, et nequaquam vos recesseritis a me.
verses.english: Then King Ptolemy answered, "I am the king of Egypt. I have come to my own land, and I have given them help, and I have restored the land to the city, and you shall not depart from me."

verses.latin: Et factum est bellum contra Alexandrum, quia in omnibus erant Romani cum Ptolemaeo, et praevaluit Ptolemaeus, et egressi sunt de terra.
verses.english: And a war was fought against Alexander, because the Romans were in everything with Ptolemy, and Ptolemy prevailed and they departed from the land.

verses.latin: Et congregavit Ptolemaeus omnes potentias, et venit in Syriam, et cepit civitates multas, et occidit eos.
verses.english: And Ptolemy gathered all his forces and came into Syria and took many cities and killed them.

verses.latin: Et misit ad Simonem litteras magnam, et fecit ad eum in Ammathunte, qui est juxta montem, ut ad eum veniret.
verses.english: And he sent a great letter to Simon and made an appointment with him in Ammathunte, which is near the mountain, that he should come to him.

verses.latin: Et abiit ad eum, et vidit gloriam ejus, et exercitum, et apparatum, et timuit, et fecit contra eum, et noluit ei facere injuriam.
verses.english: And he went to him and saw his glory, his army, and his equipment and was afraid, and he acted against him and did not want to do him harm.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei, quia fecissent quidquid voluissent contra Simonem, et fecissent eum regem, et quicumque esset eorum, vel amicus, et inimicus.
verses.english: And they said to him that they would do whatever they wished against Simon, and make him king, and whoever was their friend or enemy.

verses.latin: Et, quoniam habebat Simon, ut vidit, quia iratus est, et timuit, et posuit manus contra eum, et fecit ei violentiam: et erat vir senex.
verses.english: And because Simon saw that he was angry, he was afraid and laid his hands on him, and did him violence, for he was an old man.

verses.latin: Et occiderunt eum, et filios ejus, et fratres ejus. Et misit et misit exercitum suum, et occidit eos, et imposuit eis violentiam.
verses.english: And they killed him and his sons and his brothers. And he sent and sent his army and killed them and inflicted violence on them.

verses.latin: Et factus est bellum, et exierunt filii Israel de agro, et veniebant in loco bellorum: et iratus est, et praevaluit.
verses.english: And war was made, and the children of Israel went out of the field and came to the place of battles, and he was angry and prevailed.

verses.latin: Et audiens Alexander, rex Syriae, fecit aggregari potentias suas omnes, et venit in Syriam.
verses.english: And Alexander, the king of Syria, hearing of this, gathered all his forces together and came into Syria.

verses.latin: Et congregavit exercitum multum valde, et praevaluit contra Ptolemaeum, et fugavit eum de terra sua.
verses.english: And he gathered a very large army and prevailed against Ptolemy and drove him from his land.

verses.latin: Et pugnavit Alexander bellum in terra, et venerunt ei de civitatibus fortissimis.
verses.english: And Alexander fought a war in the land, and those from the strongest cities came to him.

verses.latin: Et dedit ei civitatem fortissimam, et fecit eum principem omnium, qui circa eum erant.
verses.english: And he gave him a very strong city, and he made him the leader of all who were around him.

verses.latin: Et audiens Jonathan, misit ad eum legatos, rogans ut faceret secum amicitiam.
verses.english: And Jonathan, hearing of this, sent ambassadors to him, asking him to make friendship with him.

verses.latin: Et acceptus est ab eo, et misit ad eum litteras, dicens:
verses.english: And he was accepted by him and sent letters to him saying:

verses.latin: Rex Alexander fratri Jonathan salutem.
verses.english: King Alexander to his brother Jonathan, greetings.

verses.latin: Audivimus de te, quod vir potens es virtute, et dignus esses esse amicus noster.
verses.english: We have heard of you that you are a man powerful in virtue and that you deserve to be our friend.

verses.latin: Ideo constituimus te hodie sacerdotem magnorum, et qui es de amicis regis.
verses.english: Therefore, we have appointed you today to be a high priest and one of the king's friends.

verses.latin: Et misit illi et pallium purpurae, et coronam auream, et dedit ei.
verses.english: And he sent him a purple cloak and a golden crown, and he gave them to him.

verses.latin: Et induit se Jonathan, et erat in die sollemnitatis mensium septimorum, et coepit exire in populum, et sacrificavit.
verses.english: And Jonathan put them on, and was in the day of the feast of the seventh month, and began to go out to the people and sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et audiens rex Alexander, fecit eum amicum, antequam esset, ita cum eo.
verses.english: And King Alexander, hearing this, made him a friend, even before he was with him.

verses.latin: Et scripsit ad eum, dicens: Quare dedisti populo vestro legem, et fecisti pactum cum Romanis?
verses.english: And he wrote to him, saying: "Why have you given your people the law, and made a covenant with the Romans?"

verses.latin: Et iratus est multum, et fecit ei quasi contrarium, et audiens Alexander, congregavit magnas virtutes.
verses.english: And he was very angry and acted against him, and Alexander, hearing this, gathered great forces.

verses.latin: Et praecepit Jonathan, et adportavit eum contra regem in Ptolemaida. Et venit rex, et occurrit ei, et pugnavit.
verses.english: And he commanded Jonathan and brought him before the king in Ptolemais. And the king came and met him and fought.

verses.latin: Et fugerunt de Ptolemaida, et secuti sunt usque ad portas. Et ceciderunt de Ptolemaida circa tria millia virorum.
verses.english: And they fled from Ptolemais and pursued them to the gates, and about three thousand men fell from Ptolemais.

verses.latin: Et accepit Jonathan gladium Alexandri, et exierunt de civitate, et fugerunt.
verses.english: And Jonathan took Alexander's sword, and they went out of the city and fled.

verses.latin: Et pugnavit Jonathan in Bethsura, et congressi sunt proelium.
verses.english: And Jonathan fought in Bethsura, and they came together in battle.

verses.latin: Et misit Alexander ad Jonathan litteras, in pacem. Et misit Jonathan, quia pacem erat agens, et ad eum, in pacem.
verses.english: And Alexander sent letters to Jonathan in peace. And Jonathan sent to him, for he was acting in peace and to him, in peace.

verses.latin: Et posuit rex Alexander Jonathan in honorem, et donavit ei possessiones, et divisiones.
verses.english: And King Alexander put Jonathan in honor and gave him possessions and divisions.

verses.latin: Et exivit Jonathan in Ptolomaium, et occurrit ei rex Alexander: et fecit ei honorem magnum.
verses.english: And Jonathan went out to Ptolemais, and King Alexander met him, and he honored him greatly.

verses.latin: Et accepit eum, et convenerunt, et dormierunt simul.
verses.english: And he took him and they met and slept together.

verses.latin: Et eduxit Alexander, et perrexit in Aegyptum, et regnavit.
verses.english: And Alexander went out and went into Egypt and reigned.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est Ptolemaeus, rex Aegypti, qui fecit Philippum filium suum regnare, qui fuit in Aegypto decem et octo annis.
verses.english: And Ptolemy, the king of Egypt, died, and he made his son Philip reign, who was in Egypt for eighteen years.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est Philippus, et regnavit Demetrius.
verses.english: And Philip died, and Demetrius reigned.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quadragesimo quarto, miserunt hi, qui erant Romæ, ad populum Macedoniæ, ad Judæos, salutem.
verses.english: In the year one hundred and forty-four, those who were in Rome sent greetings to the people of Macedonia and to the Jews.

verses.latin: Accepta sunt autem in Judæa ista verba.
verses.english: The Jews in Judea received this message.

verses.latin: Et miserunt Romanis et Atheniensibus, et Chaldaeis et omnibus nationibus in eodem loco colligentibus se, in terram Judæ.
verses.english: They also sent to the Romans, Athenians, Chaldeans, and all the nations gathered in the same place in the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et hoc exemplum litterarum: “Judæi fratres, populo Romanorum, salutem et prosperitatem.
verses.english: This is a copy of the letter: "The Jewish brothers send greetings and prosperity to the people of Rome.

verses.latin: Si valete, et nos valemus.
verses.english: If you are well, we are well.

verses.latin: Nos enim, propter bellum, quod habuimus cum Philippo et cum iis, qui cum eo fuerunt, usque ad tempus, habuimus hæc, scilicet ad vos, et adversum vos.
verses.english: Because of the war we had with Philip and those who were with him, we have had to deal with various events, which concerned both you and us.

verses.latin: Miserunt enim vobis, et miserunt nobis, litteras: scribentes, ut confirmaremus foedus cum vobis.
verses.english: You sent us a letter and we sent you one also, asking that we might confirm our treaty with you.

verses.latin: Nos ergo tempore, quo scripsimus vobis, hæc, scripsimus ad fratres nostros Judæos, et ad sacerdotes vestros, ut vos non despicerent, sed observarent hæc.
verses.english: So, at the time we wrote to you, we wrote to our Jewish brothers and your priests. We asked them not to ignore but to observe these things.

verses.latin: Et sicut placuit nobis, ita et vobis placeat.
verses.english: We are hoping what we have agreed upon is what you agree upon also.

verses.latin: Misimus ergo vobis nunc Antiochum, et Jasonem, filios Jasonis, et miserunt vobis Romani, ad confirmanda vobiscum, et confirmanda vobiscum, quae scripsimus.
verses.english: Therefore, we are sending you Antiochus and Jason, the sons of Jason, and the Romans sent them to you to confirm what we have written, and for you to confirm what we have written.

verses.latin: Et nunc bene valete.”
verses.english: And now, farewell.""

verses.latin: Hæ litteræ scriptæ sunt Romæ in diebus primis mensis Spartii.
verses.english: This letter was written in Rome on the first days of the month of Spartius.

verses.latin: Iis autem, qui erant in Judæa, et Judæis, qui erant in terra, scripserunt.
verses.english: They wrote to those who were in Judea, and to the Jews who were in the land.

verses.latin: Fratres Judæi, salutem, et prosperitatem.
verses.english: "Jewish brothers, greetings and prosperity.

verses.latin: Populus Romanorum et Judæorum, pacem et salutem vobis in perpetuum: Deus det vobis gratiam, et in tempore, et nunc.
verses.english: The people of Rome and the Jews wish you peace and prosperity forever. May God grant you grace, both now and in the future.

verses.latin: Miserunt nobis Romani legatos, ad confirmanda vobiscum amicitiam, et foedus.
verses.english: The Romans sent envoys to us to confirm friendship and a treaty with you.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt decreta, ut nos et populus noster, et vos, et terra vestra, non inferamus bellum.
verses.english: They established decrees so that we, our people, you, and your land would not wage war.

verses.latin: Si ergo bellum vobis inferatur primum a Romanis, aut ab aliquo ex sociis eorum, resistemus pro vobis, si poterimus.
verses.english: Therefore, if war is first waged against you by the Romans or any of their allies, we will defend you to the best of our ability.

verses.latin: Rursum, si vobis bellum inferatur primum, Romanis, nos adjungemus vobis.
verses.english: Likewise, if war is first waged against the Romans, we will join with you.

verses.latin: Hæc autem, sicut ipsi decreverunt, ita et confirmavimus.
verses.english: We have confirmed these things just as they decreed.

verses.latin: Hæc verba scripta sunt Romæ, in diebus primis mensis Spartii.
verses.english: These words were written in Rome on the first days of the month of Spartius.

verses.latin: Deinde miserunt litteras ad regem Demetrium, et ad omnem nationem, quae erat in Asia, et ad eos, qui erant in Judæa, et in pace.
verses.english: Then they sent letters to King Demetrius and to every nation in Asia, and to those in Judea, and to those at peace.

verses.latin: Judæi fratres, salutem et prosperitatem, et sanitatem.
verses.english: Jewish brothers, greetings, prosperity, and health.

verses.latin: Demetrius, et parentes ejus, vobis et populo Judæorum, pacem fecimus.
verses.english: Demetrius and his ancestors have made peace with you and the Jewish people.

verses.latin: Et hoc verbum, quod scripsimus vobis, confirmavimus.
verses.english: We have confirmed these words we wrote to you.

verses.latin: Si ergo vultis pacisci nobiscum, scribitis nobis, et nos scribemus vobis.
verses.english: So, if you want to make a treaty with us, write to us, and we will write to you.

verses.latin: Confirmatum est autem populo, quod Demetrius dedit nobis pacem.
verses.english: The people confirmed that Demetrius had granted us peace.

verses.latin: Rex enim Demetrius vidit quod erat populus Judæorum Deo, et quod pugnabant contra eos, qui sibi adversabantur.
verses.english: For King Demetrius saw that the Jewish people belonged to God, and that they fought against those who opposed them.

verses.latin: Et constituit eos in numero amicorum suorum, et misit eis honores.
verses.english: He included them among his friends and sent them honors.

verses.latin: Hæc fuit in diebus, quibus scripserunt, ad eos qui erant in Judæa.
verses.english: This was during the days when they wrote to those in Judea.

verses.latin: Ex mandato autem Romanorum, missi sunt ad Judæos, litteræ, dicentes, “Judæis, salutem et prosperitatem.
verses.english: At the command of the Romans, letters were sent to the Jews, saying, "Greetings and prosperity to the Jews.

verses.latin: Populo Romanorum et sociis, et genti Judæorum, pacem, et fortitudinem, et prosperitatem, in perpetuum.
verses.english: The people of Rome and their allies send peace, strength, and prosperity to the Jewish nation forever.

verses.latin: Si bellum vobis inferatur primum a Romanis, aut ab aliquo ex sociis eorum, resistemus pro vobis, si poterimus.
verses.english: If war is first waged against you by the Romans or any of their allies, we will defend you to the best of our ability.

verses.latin: Rursum, si vobis primum bellum inferatur, nos Romanis, adjungemus vobis.
verses.english: Again, if war is first waged against the Romans, we will join with you.

verses.latin: In his autem verbis, scribentes, deinde dedimus ad eos, qui erant in Judæa.
verses.english: These words, written, we sent them to those in Judea.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quadragesimo et nono, scripsit Demetrius rex litteras Simonis sacerdotis magni, et principis gentis, et amicis ejus, et populo Judæorum, et qui in Judæa et qui in terra essent, pacem salutis dicens.
verses.english: In the one hundred and forty-ninth year, King Demetrius wrote letters to Simon the high priest and leader of the people, and to his friends, and to the Jewish people, both those in Judea and those in other lands, offering greetings of peace.

verses.latin: Et ita scriptum erat: Rex Demetrius Simonis pontifici magno, et amicis ejus, et gentibus Judæorum, salutem.
verses.english: The letters read: “King Demetrius to Simon the high priest, his friends, and the Jewish people, greetings.

verses.latin: Quoniam plagæ, quas fecerunt Judæi, et cum magno dolore nos impulerunt, nos vero gaudentes memorati eorum fortitudinem, et virtutem, et honorem, sicut Judæi volunt, hoc eis facimus.
verses.english: “Because of the troubles the Jews had caused, we have decided, though with much pain, to acknowledge their strength, courage, and honor. So we will do as the Jews wish.”

verses.latin: Præcipimus ergo eis et amicis eorum, et terræ Judææ, libertatem et remissionem: et omnium rerum, quas ceperunt Judæi, usque ad diem hunc, dimittimus et remittimus eis, et ea quæ fecerunt delicta.
verses.english: “Therefore, we decree to them and their friends, and to the land of Judea, freedom and release: and we let go and forgive them all things which the Jews have taken until this day, and all the crimes they committed.”

verses.latin: Et ea, quæ per imprudentiam fecerunt, et quæ latuerunt, dimittantur eis.
verses.english: “Let all that they did through ignorance or in secret be forgiven.”

verses.latin: Et erit in ædificatione templi, et in reparatione murorum, et in aliis rebus, pro quibus expensæ sunt impensæ.
verses.english: “We will provide for the construction of the Temple and the repair of its walls, as well as the other expenses that were required.”

verses.latin: Et deinceps quidquid Judæi facere voluerint, liceat eis facere.
verses.english: “Furthermore, the Jews will be free to do whatever they want.”

verses.latin: Et licentia data est eis, ad usus annorum, frumenti, et armorum, et quæ data sunt eis, et præmia, ad ædificandam Hierusalem.
verses.english: “We grant them permission to use grain, weapons, and the other supplies and tributes given to them, for the building of Jerusalem.”

verses.latin: Et omnia scripta erant in tabulis publicis: et posuerunt Simonem principem, ut fieret sacerdos magnus, et haberet curam templi, et daret ei honorem magno.
verses.english: All of these decrees were written in public records, and they made Simon the leader, to be the high priest, with the care of the Temple, and to give him great honor.

verses.latin: Et audivit populus hæc verba, et dicebant: Magna est fides Simonis, et filiorum ejus.
verses.english: The people heard these words and said, “Great is the faithfulness of Simon and his sons.”

verses.latin: Et quoniam populus omnis, et sacerdotes, placuerunt Simonem, ut esset principem eorum et sacerdos.
verses.english: And because all the people and the priests agreed, they chose Simon to be their leader and priest.

verses.latin: Et ut haberet curam templi, et ministrorum, et ut esset super omnia.
verses.english: He was to have care of the Temple and its ministers and be in charge of everything.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt quoque scribere in tabulis publicis, et ponere in loco sancto, quod Simon sit principem eorum, et hoc usque in perpetuum: et fecerunt ei omnes obsequium.
verses.english: They also decided to write in the public records and place in a holy place that Simon was their leader, and this was to last forever. And everyone did him homage.

verses.latin: Judæi autem fecerunt pactum cum Simonio, quod, donec vixerit, esset princeps eorum, et sacerdos magnus: et filiis ejus, donec vixerint.
verses.english: The Jews made a covenant with Simon that, as long as he lived, he would be their leader and high priest, and his sons as long as they lived.

verses.latin: Et ceterarum gentium facta contra eos, et impietates, recusaverunt.
verses.english: They refused to deal with the other nations and their wicked ways.

verses.latin: Et Simon exstruxit in Judæa castra, et munivit ea munitionibus, et armis, et congregavit copias.
verses.english: Simon built fortresses in Judea and fortified them with defenses and weapons and gathered troops.

verses.latin: Et mittebat pacem ad regem Demetrium.
verses.english: And he sent peace to King Demetrius.

verses.latin: Et rex autem Demetrius exaudivit eum, et constituit eum, et honores ejus quæ cum ipso erant.
verses.english: In turn, King Demetrius heard him, confirmed his position, and recognized his authority.

verses.latin: Et testimonium dedit ei, et honorificavit eum.
verses.english: He gave him testimony, and honored him.

verses.latin: Et audivit quod Romani, et Spartiatæ miserunt ad eum legatos, ut amicitiam facerent cum eo.
verses.english: He also learned that the Romans and Spartans sent envoys to him to make an alliance with him.

verses.latin: Et congressi sunt, et fecerunt amicitiam, et statuerunt foedus cum eo.
verses.english: They met, made an alliance, and established a treaty with him.

verses.latin: Et audivit quod Romani miserunt ad eum legatos, viri optimi, et amantissimi, et cum honore magno.
verses.english: He also heard that the Romans sent to him envoys, excellent and most beloved men, with great honor.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ad eum, ut confirmarent amicitiam, et foedus, quod fecerant cum eo.
verses.english: And they sent them to him to confirm the alliance and the treaty they had made with him.

verses.latin: Et miserunt ei litteras in tabulis æreis, et in quibus erat scriptum: Populus Romanorum, et Spartiatarum, Simoni, pontifici magno, et amicis ejus, et gentibus Judæorum, salutem.
verses.english: They sent him letters on bronze tablets, in which was written: “The people of Rome and the Spartans to Simon, the high priest, his friends, and the Jewish people, greetings.

verses.latin: Et litteras, et tabulas, quas miserunt ad vos, suscepimus.
verses.english: “We have received the letters and tablets that you sent to us.

verses.latin: Et constituimus vobiscum foedus, et amicitiam, et scribimus dicentes: Siquidem bellum vos et populum vestrum, et terram vestram moverit, non bellabimus contra vos.
verses.english: “And we have established a treaty and alliance with you, and we write saying: If anyone wages war against you, your people, and your land, we will not fight against you.

verses.latin: Et vobis, et populo vestro, et terræ vestræ, bellum moverimus, bellabimus pro vobis.
verses.english: “If we wage war against you, your people, and your land, we will fight for you.”

verses.latin: Et de his verbis, hæc est testimonium, quæ misimus vobis. Et scripsimus in tabulis æreis, et posuimus in loco sancto, ut habeamus vobis, ibi.
verses.english: “This is the testimony of these words which we send to you. And we have written them on bronze tablets and placed them in a holy place so that we may keep them with you there.”

verses.latin: Et hoc est exemplum scripturæ quæ missa est a Romanis.
verses.english: And this is the example of the writing that was sent by the Romans.

verses.latin: Romani, et Spartiatæ, Simoni, pontifici magno, et amicis ejus, et gentibus Judæorum, salutem.
verses.english: The Romans and Spartans, to Simon, the high priest, his friends, and the Jewish people, greetings.

verses.latin: Misiimus ad vos legatos nostros, ut facerent vobiscum amicitiam, et foedus: et placuit nobis.
verses.english: We have sent our envoys to you to make an alliance and treaty with you, and it has pleased us to do so.

verses.latin: Et hoc est scriptum in tabulis æreis, quod scripsimus: Et si bellum vos et populum vestrum, et terram vestram moverit, nos contra vos non bellabimus.
verses.english: And this is what is written on the bronze tablets that we have written: If anyone wages war against you, your people, and your land, we will not fight against you.

verses.latin: Et si nobis primum bellum moverint, bellabimus pro vobis.
verses.english: “And if they first wage war against us, we will fight for you.”

verses.latin: Anno centesimo sexagesimo nono, Demetrio filio Demetrii, in tempore, misit Romanus, et gens eorum, ad Simonem sacerdotem magnum et duces gentis, et senatum Judaeorum, et de pace, et societatibus
verses.english: In the one hundred and sixty-ninth year of the world, the Romans, at the right moment, sent to Simon the high priest, the leaders of the Jewish people, and the senate of the Jews to treat of peace and establish alliances.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt verba haec: Dixeruntque: Nos misimus ad te, et ad gentem tuam, propter honorem, et gloriam, et nos fecimus tecum societatem et amicitiam:
verses.english: They sent this message: "We have come to you and to your people because of your honor and glory. We seek a partnership and friendship with you.

verses.latin: Et tulerunt in hoc, arma, et auxilia, omnibus inimicis nostris.
verses.english: We now wish to take up arms and offer help to you against all your enemies."

verses.latin: Et placuerunt verba eorum coram populo, et sacerdotibus.
verses.english: Their words were well received by the people and the priests.

verses.latin: Et dixit populus: Quaeramus Simonem, ut faciat nobis pacem: et fecit pacem cum eis.
verses.english: So the people said, "Let us ask Simon to make peace with us!" And they made peace with them.

verses.latin: Et suscepit eos, et statuit eos principes, et duces, et dedit eis arma, et auxilia.
verses.english: Simon welcomed them and appointed them as leaders and officials. He gave them weapons and help.

verses.latin: Et dixit populo: Nos, et fratres nostri, et domus patris nostri, pugnavimus: et bella, et certamina, et laboriosa multa, et pro lege, et pro sanctis: et salvati sumus.
verses.english: Simon told the people, "We and our brothers and the family of our father fought many battles and struggles. We faced many hardships for the Law and the sanctuary, and we were saved.

verses.latin: Et hodie propter haec servamus potestatem.
verses.english: Therefore, today we hold the power.

verses.latin: Et factus est in isto anno captivus Demetrius, et congregati sunt, et iverunt ad Demetrium, et honorificentem eum.
verses.english: In this same year, Demetrius was taken captive. The Jews then gathered and went to Demetrius to honor him.

verses.latin: Et misit eis, et congregavit exercitum, et ait: Ego, et fratres mei, et domus patris mei, pugnavimus pro Judaeis.
verses.english: Demetrius sent a message to them, gathered his army, and said, "I and my brothers, and my father's family, fought for the Jews.

verses.latin: Et, cum venissent, auxilium dedimus eis: et donati sunt eis, honor, et Jerusalem, et quae erant eis, et confirmavi eis, et dedi eis.
verses.english: When they came, we gave them help and granted them honor, Jerusalem, and all their possessions. I confirmed all of this and gave it to them.

verses.latin: Et confirmavi eis omnia, quae sunt, quamdiu est, et in hoc fuerunt.
verses.english: I confirmed all things that are and will be for as long as this continues."

verses.latin: Et constituerunt ei, omnes viri, et omnes duces gentis, et sacerdotum, ut esset eis, amicus, et amicitiam faceret cum eo.
verses.english: So all the men, all the leaders of the people, and the priests decided that Simon should be their friend and make an alliance with him.

verses.latin: Et audierunt verba haec, et placuerunt eis: et constituerunt in scriptis, ut scriberetur in tabulis, et poneretur in conspectu eorum.
verses.english: They heard this and were pleased, and they decided to write it down on tablets and place them before their eyes.

verses.latin: Et scripserunt in tabulis: Anno centesimo septuagesimo, a jugo gentium, remota sunt Judaei, et sacerdotum, et populus, et abominationes, et magna superbia.
verses.english: They wrote on the tablets: "In the one hundred and seventieth year, the Jews, priests, and the people have cast off the yoke of the Gentiles, along with all the abominations and great pride.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt Simonem, esse eis principem et sacerdotem magnum in aeternum, donec surgeret propheta fidelis.
verses.english: They established Simon as their leader and high priest forever, until a faithful prophet should arise.

verses.latin: Et esset dux eorum: et curam gereret de sanctis, et praeponerentur omnibus operibus.
verses.english: He would be their leader and care for the sanctuary. He would be in charge of all their works.

verses.latin: Et praeponerentur super arma, et super munitiones, et super vasa, et super opera templi.
verses.english: He would be in charge of the weapons, the fortifications, the vessels, and the works of the Temple.

verses.latin: Et super opera templi, et filii ejus omnes haberent dignitatem, et succederent patri suo.
verses.english: His sons would all hold positions of dignity and would succeed their father.

verses.latin: Et constituit Simon filios suos: et dedit eis arma, et exercitum, et praecepit eis, ut gererent curam belli, et constitueret exercitus in terra.
verses.english: Simon appointed his sons and gave them weapons and an army. He instructed them to conduct the war and establish armies in the land.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt, in Jerusalem, Simonem, praefectum, ut munitiones aedificaret in Jerusalem, et custodiret eas: et aedificavit excelsas muros, et magnas turres, et magnum domum, et munimenta in circuitu.
verses.english: They appointed Simon as the leader in Jerusalem so that he could build fortifications and guard them. He built high walls, great towers, a large house, and fortifications all around.

verses.latin: Et misit Simon, et misit ad Demetrium, et dedit ei coronam auream, et palmas, et dedit ei de Jerusalem, et de lignis, quae erant in ea: et ita fecit.
verses.english: Simon sent a message to Demetrius and gave him a golden crown and palm branches. He sent gifts from Jerusalem and the trees within it, and it was done.

verses.latin: Et percussit populum, et populi, qui erant in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He struck the people and the people who were in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et audivit, quod Romani audissent, et populus in terra Judaeorum audissent, quod constituerunt Simonem, principem eorum, et sacerdotem magnum, et quod haberet pro eo, amicitiam et fratres ejus: et fecerunt, cum eo.
verses.english: He heard that the Romans and the people in the land of the Jews had heard that they had appointed Simon as their leader and high priest. He heard that Simon and his brothers had made an alliance with them, and that they had done it with him.

verses.latin: Et susceperunt eum, et scripserunt in tabulis aereis, ut ponerent eas in tabulas, in monte Sion: et haec sunt exempla:
verses.english: They welcomed him and wrote it on bronze tablets to be placed on the Mount Zion. These are the examples:

verses.latin: Anno centesimo septuagesimo et duodecimo, sub Simoni, sacerdote magno, duce, et praefecto Judaeorum, et fratribus ejus,
verses.english: In the one hundred and seventy-second year, under Simon, the great high priest, leader, and governor of the Jews, and his brothers,

verses.latin: Judaei habuerunt, et congregati sunt, postquam rebellaverant, et fugerant de terra malorum.
verses.english: the Jews had gathered after they had rebelled and fled from the land of the wicked.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt, et venerunt in Jerusalem, et ascenderunt in montem Sion.
verses.english: They gathered and came to Jerusalem and ascended Mount Zion.

verses.latin: Et viderunt, quod sanctum, et erant prophanata, et polluta.
verses.english: They saw that the sanctuary had been defiled and polluted.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt: Et postquam mundati sunt, constituerunt Simonem, dederuntque ei arma.
verses.english: They decided, and after they had purified themselves, they appointed Simon and gave him weapons.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt eum sacerdotem magnum, et filios ejus, in aeternum, donec surgeret propheta fidelis.
verses.english: They established him as high priest and his sons forever, until a faithful prophet would arise.

verses.latin: Et fuit, in omni terra Judaeorum.
verses.english: And it was throughout all the land of the Jews.

verses.latin: Et factum est: Et aedificavit Jerusalem: et munitiones, quae erant circum circa, et domum, et muros circa montem Sion.
verses.english: Then it happened that they rebuilt Jerusalem and the fortifications that were all around, and the house, and the walls around Mount Zion.

verses.latin: Et hoc est exemplum, quod factum est in diebus ipsorum.
verses.english: And this is the example that was created in their days.

verses.latin: Demetrius filius Seleuci, a Roma, misit litteras, et coram in tabulas, ad Jonatham, et ad nationem Judæorum, et ad eos qui erant Hierosolymis.
verses.english: Demetrius, the son of Seleucus, sent letters from Rome, written on tablets, to Jonathan, and to the Jewish nation, and to those in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Hæc verba : Rex Demetrius salutem nationi Judæorum, et senatui, et Judæis qui in Judæa sunt, salutem et pacem.
verses.english: The words in the letter were these: “King Demetrius sends greetings to the Jewish nation, and to the Senate, and to the Jews who are in Judea, greetings and peace.”

verses.latin: Quoniam meminimus vestri boni animi, et voluntatis in nos, et amicitiam, et gratiam, quam erga nos habuistis, et ob hoc gaudemus.
verses.english: “Because we remember your good spirit, and goodwill towards us, and the friendship and favor that you have shown towards us, and for this, we are glad.”

verses.latin: Ob quam causam decrevimus vobis, et generi vestro, immunitatem a tributis, et donare vobis, quodcumque donamus aliis gentibus.
verses.english: “For this reason, we have decreed for you, and for your race, immunity from taxes, and we give to you whatever we give to other nations.”

verses.latin: Et nunc dimitto vos, et Judæos, et Hierosolymitanos, et terminos vestros, et ædificabo civitatem, et restituam vasa, et quidquid ereptum est de templo, restituam vobis.
verses.english: “And now, I release you, and the Jews, and the people of Jerusalem, and your borders, and I will rebuild the city, and I will restore the vessels, and whatever was taken from the Temple, I will return to you.”

verses.latin: Et cito misit litteras ad Jonatham, ita dicens :
verses.english: And quickly, he sent letters to Jonathan, saying thus:

verses.latin: Rex Demetrius ad fratrem Jonatham, et Judæis, et senatui Judæorum, et reliquis qui cum illis sunt, salutem.
verses.english: “King Demetrius to the brother Jonathan, and to the Jews, and to the Senate of the Jews, and to the rest who are with them, greetings.”

verses.latin: Quoniam exaudivimus te, et nos decrevimus, sicut dixisti, et mandavimus de servis nostris, qui sunt ad nos, ut paciscerentur vobiscum.
verses.english: “Because we have heard you, and we have decreed as you have said, and we have commanded our servants who are with us, to make peace with you.”

verses.latin: Testimonium autem, quæ exiit de nobis ad te, firmabimus :
verses.english: “We will affirm the testimony which comes from us to you:”

verses.latin: ut, quæ statuistis cum populo nostro, rata sint. Si qua autem fuerint de his statuta, nescientes, emendemus.
verses.english: “That whatever you have decided with our people be ratified. But if there were any decrees made by those who didn't know, we will amend them.”

verses.latin: Et nunc mandavimus servis nostris, ut loquantur vobiscum in pace, et in pace parere vobis.
verses.english: “And now we have commanded our servants to speak with you in peace, and to obey you in peace.”

verses.latin: Et hæc scripta sunt, in anno centesimo septuagesimo, et in eo, in quo cessare cœperunt bella et prælia.
verses.english: And these letters were written in the one hundred and seventieth year, and in that year, the wars and battles ceased.

verses.latin: Et audivit rex Romanorum, quod missi essent in Judæam, et inquit :
verses.english: And the king of the Romans heard that they had been sent into Judea, and said:

verses.latin: Nos etiam mittemus ad eos, qui sunt in Judæa, et transmittemus ad eos, qui sunt in Judæa, et pacem et amicitiam, ut conscribantur cum Jonatham, et cum Judæis.
verses.english: “We also will send to those who are in Judea, and we will send to them who are in Judea, peace and friendship, so that they might be enrolled with Jonathan and with the Jews.”

verses.latin: Et misit in Judæam litteras, et inquam : Senatus Romanorum, Jonathæ, et gentibus Judæorum, salutem et felicitatem.
verses.english: And he sent letters into Judea, and said: “The Senate of the Romans, to Jonathan, and to the nation of the Jews, greetings and happiness.”

verses.latin: Si bellum suscepistis contra nos, non habemus, quoniam non nos pugnamus cum vobis.
verses.english: “If you have undertaken a war against us, we do not have one, because we do not fight with you.”

verses.latin: Nunc ergo scimus, quod vos electi estis, in amicos nostros et socios :
verses.english: “Now, therefore, we know that you have been chosen as our friends and allies:”

verses.latin: et mandavimus, ut deinceps loquamur vobiscum :
verses.english: “And we have commanded that henceforth we will speak with you:”

verses.latin: sicut et populo nostro, et in regno nostro, et quicumque mittunt ad nos de vobis, bene faciemus.
verses.english: “Just as to our people, and in our kingdom, and whatever you send to us, we will do well for you.”

verses.latin: Et hoc quod scripsit, Romani, et ad Judæos, in tabulis æreis, ut haberent memoriam pacis, et auxilii, et miserunt Romam, ad habendum apud se.
verses.english: And this which the Romans wrote to the Jews, on bronze tablets, so that they might have a reminder of peace and help, and they sent it to Rome, to have it with them.

verses.latin: Postea vero, et Simon, adscribens, misit ad Jonatham fratrem suum, et habebat illi pro subsidio bellorum, et constituens omnem exercitum, misit ad eum.
verses.english: After this, indeed, Simon, also writing, sent to Jonathan his brother, and he was with him for the support of the wars, and he appointed the entire army and sent it to him.

verses.latin: Et audivit Numenius filius Antioch, et Jason filius Eleazari, et missi a Judæa, quod abusus esset in rebus Judæorum.
verses.english: And Numenius, the son of Antioch, and Jason, the son of Eleazar, the envoys from Judea, heard that the Jewish people had been mistreated.

verses.latin: Et coeperunt quærere, et voluerunt interficere eos qui erant cum Jonathae, et non potuerunt :
verses.english: And they began to search, and they wanted to kill those who were with Jonathan, but they could not:

verses.latin: quoniam denuntiatus est Jonathae, et dedit illos, et non potuerunt, facere quicquam contra illos.
verses.english: because Jonathan had been informed, and he delivered them, and they could not do anything against them.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in Gazam, et qui erant in Gaza, expulerunt eos, et clausit eos Jonathan, et qui erant cum illo, Hierusalem.
verses.english: And they came to Gaza, and those who were in Gaza expelled them, and Jonathan and those with him shut them in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et cognovit Dominus, et dedit illos in manu ejus.
verses.english: And the Lord knew, and gave them into his hand.

verses.latin: Et pugnavit contra eos, et illos, qui venerant, et omnes quæ erant cum illis, in terra, et succendit igni portas, quæ erant circa Gazam, et diripuit eos, et combussit eos.
verses.english: And he fought against them and those who had come, and all those who were with them on the land, and he set fire to the gates, which were around Gaza, and plundered them, and burned them.

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt contra eos, et omnes qui erant cum illo, et interfecerunt eos : et acceperunt spolia eorum magna.
verses.english: And they fought against them, and all who were with him, and killed them; and they took great spoils from them.

verses.latin: Et factum est, quod, cum audisset Demetrius quod venerant Jonathan et qui cum ipso erant, ad castra contra se, et pugnarent, et factus esset fortissimus, et profligasset eos in prælio,
verses.english: And it happened that, when Demetrius heard that Jonathan and those with him had come to the camp against him, and were fighting, and had become very strong, and had routed them in battle,

verses.latin: iratus est valde.
verses.english: he was very angry.

verses.latin: Et statim misit, et congregavit fortissimos viros, et mandavit, et venit exercitus.
verses.english: And immediately he sent, and gathered the strongest men, and gave orders, and the army came.

verses.latin: Et venit in Antiochiam, et constituit duos duces exercitus sui, in eos, et in eos qui erant cum Jonathae, et mandavit eis ut cito venirent.
verses.english: And he came to Antioch, and appointed two commanders of his army against them, and against those who were with Jonathan, and commanded them to come quickly.

verses.latin: Et venit ad Jonatham, et dixit : Nos contra te : et egressi sunt Jonathan et qui cum illo erant, ad bellum, et dimicaverunt.
verses.english: And he came to Jonathan, and said: “We are against you.” And Jonathan and those with him went out to battle, and they fought.

verses.latin: Et in castra eorum misit, et qui erant cum Jonatha, et vicerunt omnes, et fugerunt.
verses.english: And they were sent into their camp, and those with Jonathan conquered all, and they fled.

verses.latin: Et accepit Jonathan, et qui erant cum eo, spolia eorum.
verses.english: And Jonathan and those who were with him took their spoils.

verses.latin: Et percussit, qui erant in Ascalon, et qui erant cum illo, et egressi sunt de terra eorum.
verses.english: And he struck those in Ashkelon, and those who were with him, and they went out from their land.

verses.latin: Et die sequenti, abiit in Bethsura, civitatem munitam : et occurrerunt illi, et salutaverunt eum, et dederunt illi, et qui erant cum illo, multa.
verses.english: And the next day, he went to Beth-zur, a fortified city, and they met him, and greeted him, and gave him and those who were with him many things.

verses.latin: Et audiens rex Demetrius hæc, iterum misit in Bethsura, et scripsit litteras.
verses.english: And King Demetrius, hearing these things, sent again to Beth-zur, and wrote letters:

verses.latin: Jonathae pax, et gentibus Judæorum, et exercitui :
verses.english: “Peace to Jonathan, and to the Jewish nation, and to the army:”

verses.latin: quoniam ego pugnavi pro vobis, et fratribus vestris, et filiis vestris, et feci illos venire, et misi eos ad vos, cum omnibus rebus eorum.
verses.english: “Because I have fought for you, and for your brothers, and for your sons, and I have caused them to come, and I have sent them to you, with all their belongings.”

verses.latin: Si ergo aliquis eorum qui sunt in Judæa, fugerint de locis suis, et ad me venerint, ego vindicabo illos pro vobis, et pro fratribus vestris.
verses.english: “Therefore, if any of them who are in Judea have fled from their places, and have come to me, I will vindicate them for you and for your brothers.”

verses.latin: Et nunc constituam vos socios et amicos, et mittam vos in curiam meam, ut videatis quæ mihi sunt necessaria.
verses.english: “And now I will appoint you as allies and friends, and I will send you to my court, so that you may see what is necessary for me.”

verses.latin: Et misit in civitatem Hierusalem, ut daret illis munera, et sacrificia, et iucunda, et statuerunt illis et donaverunt.
verses.english: And he sent into the city of Jerusalem, to give them gifts, and sacrifices, and pleasant things, and they granted and gave to them.

verses.latin: Et acceperunt illi, et deinde, et ædificaverunt cum Jonatha, et cum omnibus fratribus suis, et cum eo qui erat in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And they received, and then, and they built with Jonathan, and with all his brothers, and with him who was in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et viderunt omnes opera Jonathæ, et quoniam ipse pugnavit, et sustinuit fortissime, et omnem laborem, et congrediebantur cum illo.
verses.english: And they all saw the works of Jonathan, and that he fought, and endured most bravely, and all the labor, and they joined with him.

verses.latin: Et elegerunt eum, et constituerunt principem suum, et duxerunt bellum cum gentibus, et cum gentibus, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And they chose him, and appointed him as their leader, and waged war with the nations, and with the nations, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quinquagesimo nono, miserat Demetrius rex litteras, et congregavit populum cum magna multitudine: et venit in terram Judae.
verses.english: In the one hundred and fifty-ninth year, King Demetrius sent letters and gathered the people in a great multitude, and he entered the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et audiens Jonathan, fecit in Hierusalem exire contra illum: et percussit eos.
verses.english: Upon hearing this, Jonathan ordered an army to go out of Jerusalem to confront him, and they attacked them.

verses.latin: Et misit Demetrius litteras ad Jonathan pacifice, et magna promissione: non enim sustinebat animam suam.
verses.english: Demetrius sent a letter to Jonathan in peace and with a great promise because he was growing weak.

verses.latin: Dicebat enim: Praeoccupemus bellum, antequam conveniant cum Alexandro, et faciamus ei haec.
verses.english: He said, “Let us strike first before they join with Alexander, and let us do these things to him.”

verses.latin: Et misit Demetrius litteras ad Jonathan, dicens: Faciemus te, et amicos tuos, et civitatem tuam sanctam, in magnis rebus: et si hoc sustinueris, omnia quae petieris a nobis, facies.
verses.english: Demetrius sent a letter to Jonathan, saying, “We will make you and your friends and your holy city great, and if you do these things for us, you will have whatever you ask of us.”

verses.latin: Et dedit Jonathan, in Hierusalem, arma bellica: et dixit eis: Pugnabimus pro vobis.
verses.english: Then Jonathan, in Jerusalem, supplied the people with weapons and said to them, “We will fight for you.”

verses.latin: Et elegit omnes viros bellatores: et praeparavit, et pugnavit contra Demetrium: et exivit de terra: et venerunt qui erant cum Demetrio.
verses.english: And Jonathan selected the men of war and prepared, and fought against Demetrius, and the army departed from the land, and the army that was with Demetrius came.

verses.latin: Et venerunt in terram Judae: et praemisit Demetrius litteras ad Jonathan cum pace, et dixit: Ne faciamus vobis hoc.
verses.english: And they came into the land of Judea, and Demetrius sent a letter to Jonathan in peace, and said, “Let us not do this to you.”

verses.latin: Et dedit ei gloriam: et confirmavit eum: et omnes quos dimisit, et quos captivos reduxit.
verses.english: And he gave him glory and confirmed him and all the prisoners he released.

verses.latin: Et venit Hierosolymam, et intrat in domum templi: et audivit quia Joannes filius Abisalom erat in Gadara: et statuit in Gadara.
verses.english: Then he came to Jerusalem and entered the house of the temple and heard that John, the son of Absalom, was in Gadara, and he stationed himself in Gadara.

verses.latin: Et misit, et misit ex Gadara viros, ut tollerent eum: et missi venerunt, et percusserunt eum: et interfecerunt eum.
verses.english: And he sent men from Gadara to take him, and those sent came and struck him and killed him.

verses.latin: Et reliquum vero sermonum Joannis, et gestorum ejus, et virtutum quas fecit, non sunt haec scripta in libro dierum Joannis?
verses.english: And as for the rest of the words of John, and his deeds, and the virtues which he did, are these not written in the book of the days of John?
