verses.latin: Et factus est superbia in populo: et cognovit quod Joannes mortuus esset.
verses.english: And there was great pride among the people, and they knew that John was dead.

verses.latin: Et misit, et comprehenderunt: et occiderunt filios Jambri, et qui erant in Gazara: et post haec, coepit pugna iterum in Judaea.
verses.english: And they sent and apprehended and killed the sons of Jambri and those in Gazara, and after this, a fight began again in Judea.

verses.latin: Et congregavit Jonathan omnem populum, et exivit ad bellum: et venit in Casali, et posuit illic castra.
verses.english: And Jonathan gathered all the people and went out to war, and he came to Casali and placed the camp there.

verses.latin: Et misit Simon, et posuit castra contra Casali: et confligebant multos dies.
verses.english: And Simon sent and placed the camp opposite Casali, and they fought for many days.

verses.latin: Et constituerunt qui erant in Casali, cum Jonathan, ad pacem: et dederunt ei dexteras suas: et accepit eos, et abiit in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And those in Casali made peace with Jonathan and gave him their right hands, and he took them and went into Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et fecit Jonathan, et accepit senes, et fecit consilium, et dedit eis arma bellica.
verses.english: And Jonathan chose elders and sought counsel and gave them weapons of war.

verses.latin: Et audiens Tryphon, quod Jonathan congregasset multas copias, cogitavit occidere eum.
verses.english: And Tryphon, hearing that Jonathan had gathered many troops, planned to kill him.

verses.latin: Et venit in Bethsan, et exivit contra eum: et Jonathan cum quadraginta viris electis, et cum eo, venit in Bethsan.
verses.english: And he came to Bethsan and went out against him, and Jonathan went to Bethsan with forty chosen men.

verses.latin: Et cognovit Tryphon, et posuit ibi insidias, ut occideret eum: et erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Tryphon knew, and he set an ambush there to kill him, and they were with him.

verses.latin: Et ait Jonathan ad Simonem fratrem suum: Elige viros, et exi: et pugnabimus pro fratribus nostris: et timor illorum non turbabit eos.
verses.english: And Jonathan said to Simon his brother, “Choose men and go out, and we will fight for our brothers, and their fear will not disturb them.”

verses.latin: Et dedit eis arma, et dixit eis: Pugnate donec moriamur.
verses.english: And he gave them weapons and said to them, “Fight until we die.”

verses.latin: Et pugnaverunt, et Jonathan et qui erant cum eo: et ceciderunt et Simon et qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: And Jonathan and those with him fought, and Simon and those with him fell.

verses.latin: Et contristatus est populus, et cognovit quod mortuus esset Jonathan, et doluerunt illum: et erant.
verses.english: And the people were sorrowful and knew that Jonathan was dead, and they mourned for him, and they were...

verses.latin: Et congregavit autem omnes qui erant in terra: et conglobavit omnes qui erant in finibus Judaeae, ut facerent bellum contra eos qui erant in terra.
verses.english: But he gathered all those who were in the land and gathered all those who were in the borders of Judea, to make war against those who were in the land.

verses.latin: Et exiit Simon, et posuit castra contra eos: et confligebant multos dies: et posuerunt illos.
verses.english: And Simon went out and placed the camp against them, and they fought for many days, and they stationed themselves.

verses.latin: Et accepit illos, et persecutus est eos: et percussit viros bellatores: et confregit manus eorum.
verses.english: And he took them and pursued them and struck the men of war and broke their hands.

verses.latin: Et congregavit, et posuit castra contra urbem: et turres fabricavit.
verses.english: And he gathered and placed the camp against the city and built towers.

verses.latin: Et accepit Simon, et qui erant cum eo: et tradiderunt illis arma bellica, et posuerunt castra: et tradiderunt illis arma bellica.
verses.english: And Simon and those with him took and gave them weapons of war and placed the camp, and they gave them weapons of war.

verses.latin: Et dederunt eis pacem, et exierunt de terra: et accepit civitatem, et purgavit eam a pollutione: et adduxit in ea habitatores: et aedificavit in ea.
verses.english: And they gave them peace, and they went out of the land, and he took the city and cleansed it from defilement and brought inhabitants into it and built in it.

verses.latin: Et qui erant in terra Judaeae, viderunt opera Simonis, et gloriam quam fecit populo suo: et congregavit senes et majores natu.
verses.english: And those who were in the land of Judea saw the works of Simon and the glory which he did for his people, and he gathered the elders and the older men.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ad se: Constituamus Simonem regem, et filios ejus, et populum suum, et pugnabit pro nobis.
verses.english: And they said to themselves, “Let us make Simon king and his sons and his people, and he will fight for us.”

verses.latin: Et placuerunt verba haec in conspectu populi: et constituerunt regem Simonem, in omnibus diebus vitae suae, et filios ejus, donec moreretur.
verses.english: And these words pleased the people, and they made Simon king for all the days of his life and his sons until he died.

verses.latin: Et fecit cum illis pactum: et accepit cum illis castra.
verses.english: And he made a pact with them and took the camps with them.

verses.latin: Et facta est pugna in terra, et cessavit: et Simon glorificatus est, et dedit pacem in terra.
verses.english: And there was war in the land, and he ceased, and Simon was glorified and gave peace in the land.

verses.latin: Et aedificavit in Judaea: et murum magnum circa Hierusalem: et aedificavit alta, et turres magnas circa Hierusalem: et circa eos.
verses.english: And he built in Judea a great wall around Jerusalem and built high places and great towers around Jerusalem and around them.

verses.latin: Et misit Jonathan, in exercitum, ut congregaretur, et haberet arma bellica: et dedit eis arma bellica.
verses.english: And he sent Jonathan into the army to gather and have weapons of war and gave them weapons of war.
